  ## [List users in course](#method.courses.users)<a name='method.courses.users'></a>


[CoursesController#users](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/courses_controller.rb)







  
#### `GET /api/v1/courses/:course_id/users`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/users`

  
#### `GET /api/v1/courses/:course_id/search_users`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/search_users`


<p>Returns the paginated list of users in this course. And optionally the user’s enrollments in the course.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```search_term``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The partial name or full ID of the users to match and return in the results list.</p>  |
| ```sort``` |  ```string``` |  <p>When set, sort the results of the search based on the given field.</p>  Allowed values: `username`, `last_login`, `email`, `sis_id`  |
| ```enrollment_type[]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>When set, only return users where the user is enrolled as this type. “student_view” implies include[]=test_student. This argument is ignored if enrollment_role is given.</p>  Allowed values: `teacher`, `student`, `student_view`, `ta`, `observer`, `designer`  |
| ```enrollment_role``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Deprecated When set, only return users enrolled with the specified course-level role.  This can be a role created with the <a href="roles.md#method.role_overrides.add_role" title="Add Role API">Add Role API</a> or a base role type of ‘StudentEnrollment’, ‘TeacherEnrollment’, ‘TaEnrollment’, ‘ObserverEnrollment’, or ‘DesignerEnrollment’.</p>  |
| ```enrollment_role_id``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>When set, only return courses where the user is enrolled with the specified course-level role.  This can be a role created with the <a href="roles.md#method.role_overrides.add_role" title="Add Role API">Add Role API</a> or a built_in role id with type ‘StudentEnrollment’, ‘TeacherEnrollment’, ‘TaEnrollment’, ‘ObserverEnrollment’, or ‘DesignerEnrollment’.</p>  |
| ```include[]``` |  ```string``` |  <ul><li><br><p>“enrollments”:</p><br></li></ul><br><p>Optionally include with each Course the user’s current and invited enrollments. If the user is enrolled as a student, and the account has permission to manage or view all grades, each enrollment will include a ‘grades’ key with ‘current_score’, ‘final_score’, ‘current_grade’ and ‘final_grade’ values.</p><br><ul><li><br><p>“locked”: Optionally include whether an enrollment is locked.</p><br></li><li><br><p>“avatar_url”: Optionally include avatar_url.</p><br></li><li><br><p>“bio”: Optionally include each user’s bio.</p><br></li><li><br><p>“test_student”: Optionally include the course’s Test Student,</p><br></li></ul><br><p>if present. Default is to not include Test Student.</p><br><ul><li><br><p>“custom_links”: Optionally include plugin-supplied custom links for each student,</p><br></li></ul><br><p>such as analytics information</p><br><ul><li><br><p>“current_grading_period_scores”: if enrollments is included as</p><br></li></ul><br><p>well as this directive, the scores returned in the enrollment will be for the current grading period if there is one. A ‘grading_period_id’ value will also be included with the scores. if grading_period_id is nil there is no current grading period and the score is a total score.</p><br><ul><li><br><p>“uuid”: Optionally include the users uuid</p><br></li></ul>  Allowed values: `enrollments`, `locked`, `avatar_url`, `test_student`, `bio`, `custom_links`, `current_grading_period_scores`, `uuid`  |
| ```user_id``` |  ```string``` |  <p>If this parameter is given and it corresponds to a user in the course, the <code>page</code> parameter will be ignored and the page containing the specified user will be returned instead.</p>  |
| ```user_ids[]``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>If included, the course users set will only include users with IDs specified by the param. Note: this will not work in conjunction with the “user_id” argument but multiple user_ids can be included.</p>  |
| ```enrollment_state[]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>When set, only return users where the enrollment workflow state is of one of the given types. “active” and “invited” enrollments are returned by default.</p>  Allowed values: `active`, `invited`, `rejected`, `completed`, `inactive`  |



Returns a list of
 [User](users.md#user) objects.

#### `PUT /api/v1/courses/:course_id/settings`
**Scope:** `url:PUT|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/settings`


<p>Can update the following course settings:</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```allow_final_grade_override``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Let student final grades for a grading period or the total grades for the course be overridden</p>  |
| ```allow_student_discussion_topics``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Let students create discussion topics</p>  |
| ```allow_student_forum_attachments``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Let students attach files to discussions</p>  |
| ```allow_student_discussion_editing``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Let students edit or delete their own discussion replies</p>  |
| ```allow_student_organized_groups``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Let students organize their own groups</p>  |
| ```allow_student_discussion_reporting``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Let students report offensive discussion content</p>  |
| ```allow_student_anonymous_discussion_topics``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Let students create anonymous discussion topics</p>  |
| ```filter_speed_grader_by_student_group``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Filter SpeedGrader to only the selected student group</p>  |
| ```hide_final_grades``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Hide totals in student grades summary</p>  |
| ```hide_distribution_graphs``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Hide grade distribution graphs from students</p>  |
| ```hide_sections_on_course_users_page``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Disallow students from viewing students in sections they do not belong to</p>  |
| ```lock_all_announcements``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Disable comments on announcements</p>  |
| ```usage_rights_required``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Copyright and license information must be provided for files before they are published.</p>  |
| ```restrict_student_past_view``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Restrict students from viewing courses after end date</p>  |
| ```restrict_student_future_view``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Restrict students from viewing courses before start date</p>  |
| ```show_announcements_on_home_page``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Show the most recent announcements on the Course home page (if a Wiki, defaults to five announcements, configurable via home_page_announcement_limit). Canvas for Elementary subjects ignore this setting.</p>  |
| ```home_page_announcement_limit``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>Limit the number of announcements on the home page if enabled via show_announcements_on_home_page</p>  |
| ```syllabus_course_summary``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Show the course summary (list of assignments and calendar events) on the syllabus page. Default is true.</p>  |
| ```default_due_time``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Set the default due time for assignments. This is the time that will be pre-selected in the Canvas user interface when setting a due date for an assignment. It does not change when any existing assignment is due. It should be given in 24-hour HH:MM:SS format. The default is “23:59:59”. Use “inherit” to inherit the account setting.</p>  |
| ```conditional_release``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Enable or disable individual learning paths for students based on assessment</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl https://<canvas>/api/v1/courses/<course_id>/settings \
  -X PUT \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>' \
  -d 'allow_student_discussion_topics=false'
```

  ## [Get a single course](#method.courses.show)<a name='method.courses.show'></a>


[CoursesController#show](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/courses_controller.rb)







  
#### `GET /api/v1/courses/:id`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/courses/:id`

  
#### `GET /api/v1/accounts/:account_id/courses/:id`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/accounts/:account_id/courses/:id`


<p>Return information on a single course.</p>

<p>Accepts the same include[] parameters as the list action plus:</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```include[]``` |  ```string``` |  <ul><li><br><p>“all_courses”: Also search recently deleted courses.</p><br></li><li><br><p>“permissions”: Include permissions the current user has for the course.</p><br></li><li><br><p>“observed_users”: Include observed users in the enrollments</p><br></li><li><br><p>“course_image”: Include course image url if a course image has been set</p><br></li><li><br><p>“banner_image”: Include course banner image url if the course is a Canvas for Elementary subject and a banner image has been set</p><br></li><li><br><p>“concluded”: Optional information to include with Course. Indicates whether the course has been concluded, taking course and term dates into account.</p><br></li><li><br><p>“lti_context_id”: Include course LTI tool id.</p><br></li><li><br><p>“post_manually”: Include course post policy. If the post policy is manually post grades, the value will be true. If the post policy is automatically post grades, the value will be false.</p><br></li></ul>  Allowed values: `needs_grading_count`, `syllabus_body`, `public_description`, `total_scores`, `current_grading_period_scores`, `term`, `account`, `course_progress`, `sections`, `storage_quota_used_mb`, `total_students`, `passback_status`, `favorites`, `teachers`, `observed_users`, `all_courses`, `permissions`, `course_image`, `banner_image`, `concluded`, `lti_context_id`, `post_manually`  |
| ```teacher_limit``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>The maximum number of teacher enrollments to show. If the course contains more teachers than this, instead of giving the teacher enrollments, the count of teachers will be given under a <em>teacher_count</em> key.</p>  |



Returns a
 [Course](courses.md#course) object.



  ## [Update a course](#method.courses.update)<a name='method.courses.update'></a>


[CoursesController#update](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/courses_controller.rb)







  
#### `PUT /api/v1/courses/:id`
**Scope:** `url:PUT|/api/v1/courses/:id`


<p>Update an existing course.</p>

<p>Arguments are the same as Courses#create, with a few exceptions (enroll_me).</p>

<p>If a user has content management rights, but not full course editing rights, the only attribute editable through this endpoint will be “syllabus_body”</p>

<p>If an account has set prevent_course_availability_editing_by_teachers, a teacher cannot change <a href="start_at">course</a>, <a href="conclude_at">course</a>, or <a href="restrict_enrollments_to_course_dates">course</a> here.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```course[account_id]``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>The unique ID of the account to move the course to.</p>  |
| ```course[name]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The name of the course. If omitted, the course will be named “Unnamed Course.”</p>  |
| ```course[course_code]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The course code for the course.</p>  |
| ```course[start_at]``` |  ```DateTime``` |  <p>Course start date in ISO8601 format, e.g. 2011-01-01T01:00Z This value is ignored unless ‘restrict_enrollments_to_course_dates’ is set to true, or the course is already published.</p>  |
| ```course[end_at]``` |  ```DateTime``` |  <p>Course end date in ISO8601 format. e.g. 2011-01-01T01:00Z This value is ignored unless ‘restrict_enrollments_to_course_dates’ is set to true.</p>  |
| ```course[license]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The name of the licensing. Should be one of the following abbreviations (a descriptive name is included in parenthesis for reference):</p><br><ul><li><br><p>‘private’ (Private Copyrighted)</p><br></li><li><br><p>‘cc_by_nc_nd’ (CC Attribution Non-Commercial No Derivatives)</p><br></li><li><br><p>‘cc_by_nc_sa’ (CC Attribution Non-Commercial Share Alike)</p><br></li><li><br><p>‘cc_by_nc’ (CC Attribution Non-Commercial)</p><br></li><li><br><p>‘cc_by_nd’ (CC Attribution No Derivatives)</p><br></li><li><br><p>‘cc_by_sa’ (CC Attribution Share Alike)</p><br></li><li><br><p>‘cc_by’ (CC Attribution)</p><br></li><li><br><p>‘public_domain’ (Public Domain).</p><br></li></ul>  |
| ```course[is_public]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Set to true if course is public to both authenticated and unauthenticated users.</p>  |
| ```course[is_public_to_auth_users]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Set to true if course is public only to authenticated users.</p>  |
| ```course[public_syllabus]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Set to true to make the course syllabus public.</p>  |
| ```course[public_syllabus_to_auth]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Set to true to make the course syllabus to public for authenticated users.</p>  |
| ```course[public_description]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>A publicly visible description of the course.</p>  |
| ```course[allow_student_wiki_edits]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>If true, students will be able to modify the course wiki.</p>  |
| ```course[allow_wiki_comments]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>If true, course members will be able to comment on wiki pages.</p>  |
| ```course[allow_student_forum_attachments]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>If true, students can attach files to forum posts.</p>  |
| ```course[open_enrollment]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Set to true if the course is open enrollment.</p>  |
| ```course[self_enrollment]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Set to true if the course is self enrollment.</p>  |
| ```course[restrict_enrollments_to_course_dates]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Set to true to restrict user enrollments to the start and end dates of the course. Setting this value to false will remove the course end date (if it exists), as well as the course start date (if the course is unpublished).</p>  |
| ```course[term_id]``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>The unique ID of the term to create to course in.</p>  |
| ```course[sis_course_id]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The unique SIS identifier.</p>  |
| ```course[integration_id]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The unique Integration identifier.</p>  |
| ```course[hide_final_grades]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>If this option is set to true, the totals in student grades summary will be hidden.</p>  |
| ```course[time_zone]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The time zone for the course. Allowed time zones are <a href="http://www.iana.org/time-zones" target="_parent" title="IANA time zones">IANA time zones</a> or friendlier <a href="http://api.rubyonrails.org/classes/ActiveSupport/TimeZone.html" target="_parent" title="Ruby on Rails time zones">Ruby on Rails time zones</a>.</p>  |
| ```course[apply_assignment_group_weights]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Set to true to weight final grade based on assignment groups percentages.</p>  |
| ```course[storage_quota_mb]``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>Set the storage quota for the course, in megabytes. The caller must have the “Manage storage quotas” account permission.</p>  |
| ```offer``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>If this option is set to true, the course will be available to students immediately.</p>  |
| ```course[event]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The action to take on each course.</p><br><ul><li><br><p>‘claim’ makes a course no longer visible to students. This action is also called “unpublish” on the web site. A course cannot be unpublished if students have received graded submissions.</p><br></li><li><br><p>‘offer’ makes a course visible to students. This action is also called “publish” on the web site.</p><br></li><li><br><p>‘conclude’ prevents future enrollments and makes a course read-only for all participants. The course still appears in prior-enrollment lists.</p><br></li><li><br><p>‘delete’ completely removes the course from the web site (including course menus and prior-enrollment lists). All enrollments are deleted. Course content may be physically deleted at a future date.</p><br></li><li><br><p>‘undelete’ attempts to recover a course that has been deleted. This action requires account administrative rights. (Recovery is not guaranteed; please conclude rather than delete a course if there is any possibility the course will be used again.) The recovered course will be unpublished. Deleted enrollments will not be recovered.</p><br></li></ul>  Allowed values: `claim`, `offer`, `conclude`, `delete`, `undelete`  |
| ```course[default_view]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The type of page that users will see when they first visit the course</p><br><ul><li><br><p>‘feed’ Recent Activity Dashboard</p><br></li><li><br><p>‘wiki’ Wiki Front Page</p><br></li><li><br><p>‘modules’ Course Modules/Sections Page</p><br></li><li><br><p>‘assignments’ Course Assignments List</p><br></li><li><br><p>‘syllabus’ Course Syllabus Page</p><br></li></ul><br><p>other types may be added in the future</p>  Allowed values: `feed`, `wiki`, `modules`, `syllabus`, `assignments`  |
| ```course[syllabus_body]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The syllabus body for the course</p>  |
| ```course[syllabus_course_summary]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Optional. Indicates whether the Course Summary (consisting of the course’s assignments and calendar events) is displayed on the syllabus page. Defaults to <code>true</code>.</p>  |
| ```course[grading_standard_id]``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>The grading standard id to set for the course.  If no value is provided for this argument the current grading_standard will be un-set from this course.</p>  |
| ```course[grade_passback_setting]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Optional. The grade_passback_setting for the course. Only ‘nightly_sync’ and ” are allowed</p>  |
| ```course[course_format]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Optional. Specifies the format of the course. (Should be either ‘on_campus’ or ‘online’)</p>  |
| ```course[image_id]``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>This is a file ID corresponding to an image file in the course that will be used as the course image. This will clear the course’s image_url setting if set.  If you attempt to provide image_url and image_id in a request it will fail.</p>  |
| ```course[image_url]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>This is a URL to an image to be used as the course image. This will clear the course’s image_id setting if set.  If you attempt to provide image_url and image_id in a request it will fail.</p>  |
| ```course[remove_image]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>If this option is set to true, the course image url and course image ID are both set to nil</p>  |
| ```course[remove_banner_image]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>If this option is set to true, the course banner image url and course banner image ID are both set to nil</p>  |
| ```course[blueprint]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Sets the course as a blueprint course.</p>  |
| ```course[blueprint_restrictions]``` |  ```BlueprintRestriction``` |  <p>Sets a default set to apply to blueprint course objects when restricted, unless <em>use_blueprint_restrictions_by_object_type</em> is enabled. See the <a href="blueprint_courses.md#BlueprintRestriction" title="Blueprint Restriction">Blueprint Restriction</a> documentation</p>  |
| ```course[use_blueprint_restrictions_by_object_type]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>When enabled, the <em>blueprint_restrictions</em> parameter will be ignored in favor of the <em>blueprint_restrictions_by_object_type</em> parameter</p>  |
| ```course[blueprint_restrictions_by_object_type]``` |  ```multiple BlueprintRestrictions``` |  <p>Allows setting multiple <a href="blueprint_courses.md#BlueprintRestriction" title="Blueprint Restriction">Blueprint Restriction</a> to apply to blueprint course objects of the matching type when restricted. The possible object types are “assignment”, “attachment”, “discussion_topic”, “quiz” and “wiki_page”. Example usage:</p><br><pre class="code ruby"><code class="ruby"><span class='id identifier rubyid_course'>course</span><span class='lbracket'>[</span><span class='id identifier rubyid_blueprint_restrictions_by_object_type'>blueprint_restrictions_by_object_type</span><span class='rbracket'>]</span><span class='lbracket'>[</span><span class='id identifier rubyid_assignment'>assignment</span><span class='rbracket'>]</span><span class='lbracket'>[</span><span class='id identifier rubyid_content'>content</span><span class='rbracket'>]</span><span class='op'>=</span><span class='int'>1</span><br></code></pre>  |
| ```course[homeroom_course]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Sets the course as a homeroom course. The setting takes effect only when the course is associated with a Canvas for Elementary-enabled account.</p>  |
| ```course[sync_enrollments_from_homeroom]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Syncs enrollments from the homeroom that is set in homeroom_course_id. The setting only takes effect when the course is associated with a Canvas for Elementary-enabled account and sync_enrollments_from_homeroom is enabled.</p>  |
| ```course[homeroom_course_id]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Sets the Homeroom Course id to be used with sync_enrollments_from_homeroom. The setting only takes effect when the course is associated with a Canvas for Elementary-enabled account and sync_enrollments_from_homeroom is enabled.</p>  |
| ```course[template]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Enable or disable the course as a template that can be selected by an account</p>  |
| ```course[course_color]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Sets a color in hex code format to be associated with the course. The setting takes effect only when the course is associated with a Canvas for Elementary-enabled account.</p>  |
| ```course[friendly_name]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Set a friendly name for the course. If this is provided and the course is associated with a Canvas for Elementary account, it will be shown instead of the course name. This setting takes priority over course nicknames defined by individual users.</p>  |
| ```course[enable_course_paces]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Enable or disable Course Pacing for the course. This setting only has an effect when the Course Pacing feature flag is enabled for the sub-account. Otherwise, Course Pacing are always disabled.</p><br><pre class="code ruby"><code class="ruby">Note: Course Pacing is in active development.<br></code></pre>  |
| ```course[conditional_release]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Enable or disable individual learning paths for students based on assessment</p>  |
| ```course[post_manually]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>When true, all grades in the course will be posted manually. When false, all grades in the course will be automatically posted. Use with caution as this setting will override any assignment level post policy.</p>  |
| ```override_sis_stickiness``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Default is true. If false, any fields containing “sticky” changes will not be updated. See SIS CSV Format documentation for information on which fields can have SIS stickiness</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl https://<canvas>/api/v1/courses/<course_id> \
  -X PUT \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>' \
  -d 'course[name]=New course name' \
  -d 'course[start_at]=2012-05-05T00:00:00Z'
```
    


#### Example Response:
    

```js
{
  "name": "New course name",
  "course_code": "COURSE-001",
  "start_at": "2012-05-05T00:00:00Z",
  "end_at": "2012-08-05T23:59:59Z",
  "sis_course_id": "12345"
}
```
    



  ## [Update courses](#method.courses.batch_update)<a name='method.courses.batch_update'></a>


[CoursesController#batch_update](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/courses_controller.rb)







  
#### `PUT /api/v1/accounts/:account_id/courses`
**Scope:** `url:PUT|/api/v1/accounts/:account_id/courses`


<p>Update multiple courses in an account.  Operates asynchronously; use the <a href="progress.md#method.progress.show" title="progress endpoint">progress endpoint</a> to query the status of an operation.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```course_ids[]``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>List of ids of courses to update. At most 500 courses may be updated in one call.</p>  |
| ```event``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>The action to take on each course.  Must be one of ‘offer’, ‘conclude’, ‘delete’, or ‘undelete’.</p><br><ul><li><br><p>‘offer’ makes a course visible to students. This action is also called “publish” on the web site.</p><br></li><li><br><p>‘conclude’ prevents future enrollments and makes a course read-only for all participants. The course still appears in prior-enrollment lists.</p><br></li><li><br><p>‘delete’ completely removes the course from the web site (including course menus and prior-enrollment lists). All enrollments are deleted. Course content may be physically deleted at a future date.</p><br></li><li><br><p>‘undelete’ attempts to recover a course that has been deleted. (Recovery is not guaranteed; please conclude rather than delete a course if there is any possibility the course will be used again.) The recovered course will be unpublished. Deleted enrollments will not be recovered.</p><br></li></ul>  Allowed values: `offer`, `conclude`, `delete`, `undelete`  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl https://<canvas>/api/v1/accounts/<account_id>/courses \
  -X PUT \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>' \
  -d 'event=offer' \
  -d 'course_ids[]=1' \
  -d 'course_ids[]=2'
```
    


Returns a
 [Progress](progress.md#progress) object.

  ## [Get effective due dates](#method.courses.effective_due_dates)<a name='method.courses.effective_due_dates'></a>


[CoursesController#effective_due_dates](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/courses_controller.rb)







  
#### `GET /api/v1/courses/:course_id/effective_due_dates`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/effective_due_dates`


<p>For each assignment in the course, returns each assigned student’s ID and their corresponding due date along with some grading period data. Returns a collection with keys representing assignment IDs and values as a collection containing keys representing student IDs and values representing the student’s effective due_at, the grading_period_id of which the due_at falls in, and whether or not the grading period is closed (in_closed_grading_period)</p>

<p>The list of assignment IDs for which effective student due dates are requested. If not provided, all assignments in the course will be used.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```assignment_ids[]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>no description</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl https://<canvas>/api/v1/courses/<course_id>/effective_due_dates
  -X GET \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'
```
    


#### Example Response:
    

```js
{
  "1": {
     "14": { "due_at": "2015-09-05", "grading_period_id": null, "in_closed_grading_period": false },
     "15": { due_at: null, "grading_period_id": 3, "in_closed_grading_period": true }
  },
  "2": {
     "14": { "due_at": "2015-08-05", "grading_period_id": 3, "in_closed_grading_period": true }
  }
}
```

  ## [Get course copy status](#method.content_imports.copy_course_status)<a name='method.content_imports.copy_course_status'></a>

#### `GET /api/v1/courses/:course_id/course_copy/:id`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/course_copy/:id`


<p>DEPRECATED: Please use the <a href="content_migrations.md#method.content_migrations.create" title="Content Migrations API">Content Migrations API</a></p>

<p>Retrieve the status of a course copy</p>

#### API response field:


-  id


  
<p>The unique identifier for the course copy.</p>



-  created_at


  
<p>The time that the copy was initiated.</p>



-  progress


  
<p>The progress of the copy as an integer. It is null before the copying starts, and 100 when finished.</p>



-  workflow_state


  
<p>The current status of the course copy. Possible values: “created”, “started”, “completed”, “failed”</p>



-  status_url


  
<p>The url for the course copy status API endpoint.</p>





#### Example Response:
    

```js
{'progress':100, 'workflow_state':'completed', 'id':257, 'created_at':'2011-11-17T16:50:06Z', 'status_url':'/api/v1/courses/9457/course_copy/257'}
```

<p>DEPRECATED: Please use the <a href="content_migrations.md#method.content_migrations.create" title="Content Migrations API">Content Migrations API</a></p>

<p>Copies content from one course into another. The default is to copy all course content. You can control specific types to copy by using either the ‘except’ option or the ‘only’ option.</p>

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|

| ```only[]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>A list of the course content types to copy, all areas not listed will not be copied.</p>  Allowed values: `course_settings`, `assignments`, `external_tools`, `files`, `topics`, `calendar_events`, `quizzes`, `wiki_pages`, `modules`, `outcomes`  |

  ## [List discussion topics](#method.discussion_topics.index)<a name='method.discussion_topics.index'></a>


[DiscussionTopicsController#index](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/discussion_topics_controller.rb)







  
#### `GET /api/v1/courses/:course_id/discussion_topics`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/discussion_topics`

  
#### `GET /api/v1/groups/:group_id/discussion_topics`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/groups/:group_id/discussion_topics`


<p>Returns the paginated list of discussion topics for this course or group.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```include[]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>If “all_dates” is passed, all dates associated with graded discussions’ assignments will be included. if “sections” is passed, includes the course sections that are associated with the topic, if the topic is specific to certain sections of the course. If “sections_user_count” is passed, then:</p><br><pre class="code ruby"><code class="ruby">(a) If sections were asked for *and* the topic is specific to certain<br>    course sections, includes the number of users in each<br>    section. (as part of the section json asked for above)<br>(b) Else, includes at the root level the total number of users in the<br>    topic&#39;s context (group or course) that the topic applies to.<br></code></pre><br><p>If “overrides” is passed, the overrides for the assignment will be included</p>  Allowed values: `all_dates`, `sections`, `sections_user_count`, `overrides`  |
| ```order_by``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Determines the order of the discussion topic list. Defaults to “position”.</p>  Allowed values: `position`, `recent_activity`, `title`  |
| ```scope``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Only return discussion topics in the given state(s). Defaults to including all topics. Filtering is done after pagination, so pages may be smaller than requested if topics are filtered. Can pass multiple states as comma separated string.</p>  Allowed values: `locked`, `unlocked`, `pinned`, `unpinned`  |
| ```only_announcements``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Return announcements instead of discussion topics. Defaults to false</p>  |
| ```filter_by``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The state of the discussion topic to return. Currently only supports unread state.</p>  Allowed values: `all`, `unread`  |
| ```search_term``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The partial title of the discussion topics to match and return.</p>  |
| ```exclude_context_module_locked_topics``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>For students, exclude topics that are locked by module progression. Defaults to false.</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl https://<canvas>/api/v1/courses/<course_id>/discussion_topics \
     -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'
```
    


Returns a list of
 [DiscussionTopic](discussion_topics.md#discussiontopic) objects.



  ## [Create a new discussion topic](#method.discussion_topics.create)<a name='method.discussion_topics.create'></a>


[DiscussionTopicsController#create](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/discussion_topics_controller.rb)







  
#### `POST /api/v1/courses/:course_id/discussion_topics`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/discussion_topics`

  
#### `POST /api/v1/groups/:group_id/discussion_topics`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/groups/:group_id/discussion_topics`


<p>Create an new discussion topic for the course or group.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```title``` |  ```string``` |  <p>no description</p>  |
| ```message``` |  ```string``` |  <p>no description</p>  |
| ```discussion_type``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The type of discussion. Defaults to side_comment or not_threaded if not value is given. Accepted values are ‘side_comment’, ‘not_threaded’ for discussions that only allow one level of nested comments, and ‘threaded’ for fully threaded discussions.</p>  Allowed values: `side_comment`, `threaded`, `not_threaded`  |
| ```published``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Whether this topic is published (true) or draft state (false). Only teachers and TAs have the ability to create draft state topics.</p>  |
| ```delayed_post_at``` |  ```DateTime``` |  <p>If a timestamp is given, the topic will not be published until that time.</p>  |
| ```allow_rating``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Whether or not users can rate entries in this topic.</p>  |
| ```lock_at``` |  ```DateTime``` |  <p>If a timestamp is given, the topic will be scheduled to lock at the provided timestamp. If the timestamp is in the past, the topic will be locked.</p>  |
| ```podcast_enabled``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>If true, the topic will have an associated podcast feed.</p>  |
| ```podcast_has_student_posts``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>If true, the podcast will include posts from students as well. Implies podcast_enabled.</p>  |
| ```require_initial_post``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>If true then a user may not respond to other replies until that user has made an initial reply. Defaults to false.</p>  |
| ```assignment``` |  ```Assignment``` |  <p>To create an assignment discussion, pass the assignment parameters as a sub-object. See the <a href="assignments.md#method.assignments_api.create" title="Create an Assignment API">Create an Assignment API</a> for the available parameters. The name parameter will be ignored, as it’s taken from the discussion title. If you want to make a discussion that was an assignment NOT an assignment, pass set_assignment = false as part of the assignment object</p>  |
| ```is_announcement``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>If true, this topic is an announcement. It will appear in the announcement’s section rather than the discussions section. This requires announcment-posting permissions.</p>  |
| ```pinned``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>If true, this topic will be listed in the “Pinned Discussion” section</p>  |
| ```position_after``` |  ```string``` |  <p>By default, discussions are sorted chronologically by creation date, you can pass the id of another topic to have this one show up after the other when they are listed.</p>  |
| ```group_category_id``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>If present, the topic will become a group discussion assigned to the group.</p>  |
| ```only_graders_can_rate``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>If true, only graders will be allowed to rate entries.</p>  |
| ```sort_by_rating``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>If true, entries will be sorted by rating.</p>  |
| ```attachment``` |  ```File``` |  <p>A multipart/form-data form-field-style attachment. Attachments larger than 1 kilobyte are subject to quota restrictions.</p>  |
| ```specific_sections``` |  ```string``` |  <p>A comma-separated list of sections ids to which the discussion topic should be made specific to.  If it is not desired to make the discussion topic specific to sections, then this parameter may be omitted or set to “all”.  Can only be present only on announcements and only those that are for a course (as opposed to a group).</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl https://<canvas>/api/v1/courses/<course_id>/discussion_topics \
    -F title='my topic' \
    -F message='initial message' \
    -F podcast_enabled=1 \
    -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'
    -F 'attachment=@<filename>' \
```
    

```bash
curl https://<canvas>/api/v1/courses/<course_id>/discussion_topics \
    -F title='my assignment topic' \
    -F message='initial message' \
    -F assignment[points_possible]=15 \
    -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'
```

  ## [Get the full topic](#method.discussion_topics_api.view)<a name='method.discussion_topics_api.view'></a>


[DiscussionTopicsApiController#view](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/discussion_topics_api_controller.rb)







  
#### `GET /api/v1/courses/:course_id/discussion_topics/:topic_id/view`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/discussion_topics/:topic_id/view`

  
#### `GET /api/v1/groups/:group_id/discussion_topics/:topic_id/view`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/groups/:group_id/discussion_topics/:topic_id/view`


<p>Return a cached structure of the discussion topic, containing all entries, their authors, and their message bodies.</p>

<p>May require (depending on the topic) that the user has posted in the topic. If it is required, and the user has not posted, will respond with a 403 Forbidden status and the body ‘require_initial_post’.</p>

<p>In some rare situations, this cached structure may not be available yet. In that case, the server will respond with a 503 error, and the caller should try again soon.</p>

<p>The response is an object containing the following keys:</p>
<ul><li>
<p>“participants”: A list of summary information on users who have posted to the discussion. Each value is an object containing their id, display_name, and avatar_url.</p>
</li><li>
<p>“unread_entries”: A list of entry ids that are unread by the current user. this implies that any entry not in this list is read.</p>
</li><li>
<p>“entry_ratings”: A map of entry ids to ratings by the current user. Entries not in this list have no rating. Only populated if rating is enabled.</p>
</li><li>
<p>“forced_entries”: A list of entry ids that have forced_read_state set to true. This flag is meant to indicate the entry’s read_state has been manually set to ‘unread’ by the user, so the entry should not be automatically marked as read.</p>
</li><li>
<p>“view”: A threaded view of all the entries in the discussion, containing the id, user_id, and message.</p>
</li><li>
<p>“new_entries”: Because this view is eventually consistent, it’s possible that newly created or updated entries won’t yet be reflected in the view. If the application wants to also get a flat list of all entries not yet reflected in the view, pass include_new_entries=1 to the request and this array of entries will be returned. These entries are returned in a flat array, in ascending created_at order.</p>
</li></ul>


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/courses/<course_id>/discussion_topics/<topic_id>/view' \
     -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>"
```
    


#### Example Response:
    

```js
{
  "unread_entries": [1,3,4],
  "entry_ratings": {3: 1},
  "forced_entries": [1],
  "participants": [
    { "id": 10, "display_name": "user 1", "avatar_image_url": "https://...", "html_url": "https://..." },
    { "id": 11, "display_name": "user 2", "avatar_image_url": "https://...", "html_url": "https://..." }
  ],
  "view": [
    { "id": 1, "user_id": 10, "parent_id": null, "message": "...html text...", "replies": [
      { "id": 3, "user_id": 11, "parent_id": 1, "message": "...html....", "replies": [...] }
    ]},
    { "id": 2, "user_id": 11, "parent_id": null, "message": "...html..." },
    { "id": 4, "user_id": 10, "parent_id": null, "message": "...html..." }
  ]
}
```

  ## [List topic entries](#method.discussion_topics_api.entries)<a name='method.discussion_topics_api.entries'></a>


[DiscussionTopicsApiController#entries](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/discussion_topics_api_controller.rb)







  
#### `GET /api/v1/courses/:course_id/discussion_topics/:topic_id/entries`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/discussion_topics/:topic_id/entries`

  
#### `GET /api/v1/groups/:group_id/discussion_topics/:topic_id/entries`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/groups/:group_id/discussion_topics/:topic_id/entries`


<p>Retrieve the (paginated) top-level entries in a discussion topic.</p>

<p>May require (depending on the topic) that the user has posted in the topic. If it is required, and the user has not posted, will respond with a 403 Forbidden status and the body ‘require_initial_post’.</p>

<p>Will include the 10 most recent replies, if any, for each entry returned.</p>

<p>If the topic is a root topic with children corresponding to groups of a group assignment, entries from those subtopics for which the user belongs to the corresponding group will be returned.</p>

<p>Ordering of returned entries is newest-first by posting timestamp (reply activity is ignored).</p>

#### API response field:


-  id


  
<p>The unique identifier for the entry.</p>



-  user_id


  
<p>The unique identifier for the author of the entry.</p>



-  editor_id


  
<p>The unique user id of the person to last edit the entry, if different than user_id.</p>



-  user_name


  
<p>The name of the author of the entry.</p>



-  message


  
<p>The content of the entry.</p>



-  read_state


  
<p>The read state of the entry, “read” or “unread”.</p>



-  forced_read_state


  
<p>Whether the read_state was forced (was set manually)</p>



-  created_at


  
<p>The creation time of the entry, in ISO8601 format.</p>



-  updated_at


  
<p>The updated time of the entry, in ISO8601 format.</p>



-  attachment


  
<p>JSON representation of the attachment for the entry, if any. Present only if there is an attachment.</p>



-  attachments


  
<p><strong>Deprecated</strong>. Same as attachment, but returned as a one-element array. Present only if there is an attachment.</p>



-  recent_replies


  
<p>The 10 most recent replies for the entry, newest first. Present only if there is at least one reply.</p>



-  has_more_replies


  
<p>True if there are more than 10 replies for the entry (i.e., not all were included in this response). Present only if there is at least one reply.</p>





#### Example Response:
    

```js
[ {
    "id": 1019,
    "user_id": 7086,
    "user_name": "nobody@example.com",
    "message": "Newer entry",
    "read_state": "read",
    "forced_read_state": false,
    "created_at": "2011-11-03T21:33:29Z",
    "attachment": {
      "content-type": "unknown/unknown",
      "url": "http://www.example.com/files/681/download?verifier=JDG10Ruitv8o6LjGXWlxgOb5Sl3ElzVYm9cBKUT3",
      "filename": "content.txt",
      "display_name": "content.txt" } },
  {
    "id": 1016,
    "user_id": 7086,
    "user_name": "nobody@example.com",
    "message": "first top-level entry",
    "read_state": "unread",
    "forced_read_state": false,
    "created_at": "2011-11-03T21:32:29Z",
    "recent_replies": [
      {
        "id": 1017,
        "user_id": 7086,
        "user_name": "nobody@example.com",
        "message": "Reply message",
        "created_at": "2011-11-03T21:32:29Z"
      } ],
    "has_more_replies": false } ]
```

<p>Create a new enrollment term for the specified account.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```enrollment_term[name]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The name of the term.</p>  |
| ```enrollment_term[start_at]``` |  ```DateTime``` |  <p>The day/time the term starts. Accepts times in ISO 8601 format, e.g. 2015-01-10T18:48:00Z.</p>  |
| ```enrollment_term[end_at]``` |  ```DateTime``` |  <p>The day/time the term ends. Accepts times in ISO 8601 format, e.g. 2015-01-10T18:48:00Z.</p>  |
| ```enrollment_term[sis_term_id]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The unique SIS identifier for the term.</p>  |
| ```enrollment_term[overrides][enrollment_type][start_at]``` |  ```DateTime``` |  <p>The day/time the term starts, overridden for the given enrollment type. <strong>enrollment_type</strong> can be one of StudentEnrollment, TeacherEnrollment, TaEnrollment, or DesignerEnrollment</p>  |
| ```enrollment_term[overrides][enrollment_type][end_at]``` |  ```DateTime``` |  <p>The day/time the term ends, overridden for the given enrollment type. <strong>enrollment_type</strong> can be one of StudentEnrollment, TeacherEnrollment, TaEnrollment, or DesignerEnrollment</p>  |



Returns an
 [EnrollmentTerm](enrollment_terms.md#enrollmentterm) object.

**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/accounts/:account_id/terms`

```js
        },

          "start_at": null,
          "end_at": "2026-12-30T20:00:00Z"
```

[EnrollmentsApiController#index](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/enrollments_api_controller.rb)

#### `GET /api/v1/sections/:section_id/enrollments`

#### `GET /api/v1/users/:user_id/enrollments`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/users/:user_id/enrollments`


<p>Depending on the URL given, return a paginated list of either (1) all of the enrollments in a course, (2) all of the enrollments in a section or (3) all of a user’s enrollments. This includes student, teacher, TA, and observer enrollments.</p>

<p>If a user has multiple enrollments in a context (e.g. as a teacher and a student or in multiple course sections), each enrollment will be listed separately.</p>

<p>note: Currently, only a root level admin user can return other users’ enrollments. A user can, however, return his/her own enrollments.</p>

<p>Enrollments scoped to a course context will include inactive states by default if the caller has account admin authorization and the state[] parameter is omitted.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```type[]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>A list of enrollment types to return. Accepted values are ‘StudentEnrollment’, ‘TeacherEnrollment’, ‘TaEnrollment’, ‘DesignerEnrollment’, and ‘ObserverEnrollment.’ If omitted, all enrollment types are returned. This argument is ignored if ‘role` is given.</p>  |
| ```role[]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>A list of enrollment roles to return. Accepted values include course-level roles created by the <a href="roles.md#method.role_overrides.add_role" title="Add Role API">Add Role API</a> as well as the base enrollment types accepted by the ‘type` argument above.</p>  |
| ```state[]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Filter by enrollment state. If omitted, ‘active’ and ‘invited’ enrollments are returned. The following synthetic states are supported only when querying a user’s enrollments (either via user_id argument or via user enrollments endpoint): <code>current_and_invited</code>, <code>current_and_future</code>, <code>current_future_and_restricted</code>, <code>current_and_concluded</code></p>  Allowed values: `active`, `invited`, `creation_pending`, `deleted`, `rejected`, `completed`, `inactive`, `current_and_invited`, `current_and_future`, `current_future_and_restricted`, `current_and_concluded`  |
| ```include[]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Array of additional information to include on the enrollment or user records. “avatar_url” and “group_ids” will be returned on the user record. If “current_points” is specified, the fields “current_points” and (if the caller has permissions to manage grades) “unposted_current_points” will be included in the “grades” hash for student enrollments.</p>  Allowed values: `avatar_url`, `group_ids`, `locked`, `observed_users`, `can_be_removed`, `uuid`, `current_points`  |
| ```user_id``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Filter by user_id (only valid for course or section enrollment queries). If set to the current user’s id, this is a way to determine if the user has any enrollments in the course or section, independent of whether the user has permission to view other people on the roster.</p>  |
| ```grading_period_id``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>Return grades for the given grading_period.  If this parameter is not specified, the returned grades will be for the whole course.</p>  |
| ```enrollment_term_id``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>Returns only enrollments for the specified enrollment term. This parameter only applies to the user enrollments path. May pass the ID from the enrollment terms api or the SIS id prepended with ‘sis_term_id:’.</p>  |
| ```sis_account_id[]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Returns only enrollments for the specified SIS account ID(s). Does not look into sub_accounts. May pass in array or string.</p>  |
| ```sis_course_id[]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Returns only enrollments matching the specified SIS course ID(s). May pass in array or string.</p>  |
| ```sis_section_id[]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Returns only section enrollments matching the specified SIS section ID(s). May pass in array or string.</p>  |
| ```sis_user_id[]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Returns only enrollments for the specified SIS user ID(s). May pass in array or string.</p>  |
| ```created_for_sis_id[]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>If sis_user_id is present and created_for_sis_id is true, Returns only enrollments for the specified SIS ID(s). If a user has two sis_id’s, one enrollment may be created using one of the two ids. This would limit the enrollments returned from the endpoint to enrollments that were created from a sis_import with that sis_user_id</p>  |



Returns a list of
 [Enrollment](enrollments.md#enrollment) objects.

#### `POST /api/v1/sections/:section_id/enrollments`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/sections/:section_id/enrollments`


<p>Create a new user enrollment for a course or section.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```enrollment[start_at]``` |  ```DateTime``` |  <p>The start time of the enrollment, in ISO8601 format. e.g. 2012-04-18T23:08:51Z</p>  |
| ```enrollment[end_at]``` |  ```DateTime``` |  <p>The end time of the enrollment, in ISO8601 format. e.g. 2012-04-18T23:08:51Z</p>  |
| ```enrollment[user_id]``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>The ID of the user to be enrolled in the course.</p>  |
| ```enrollment[type]``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>Enroll the user as a student, teacher, TA, observer, or designer. If no value is given, the type will be inferred by <a href="role">enrollment</a> if supplied, otherwise ‘StudentEnrollment’ will be used.</p>  Allowed values: `StudentEnrollment`, `TeacherEnrollment`, `TaEnrollment`, `ObserverEnrollment`, `DesignerEnrollment`  |
| ```enrollment[role]``` |  ```Deprecated``` |  <p>Assigns a custom course-level role to the user.</p>  |
| ```enrollment[role_id]``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>Assigns a custom course-level role to the user.</p>  |
| ```enrollment[enrollment_state]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>If set to ‘active,’ student will be immediately enrolled in the course. Otherwise they will be required to accept a course invitation. Default is ‘invited.’.</p><br><p>If set to ‘inactive’, student will be listed in the course roster for teachers, but will not be able to participate in the course until their enrollment is activated.</p>  Allowed values: `active`, `invited`, `inactive`  |
| ```enrollment[course_section_id]``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>The ID of the course section to enroll the student in. If the section-specific URL is used, this argument is redundant and will be ignored.</p>  |
| ```enrollment[limit_privileges_to_course_section]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>If set, the enrollment will only allow the user to see and interact with users enrolled in the section given by course_section_id.</p><br><ul><li><br><p>For teachers and TAs, this includes grading privileges.</p><br></li><li><br><p>Section-limited students will not see any users (including teachers and TAs) not enrolled in their sections.</p><br></li><li><br><p>Users may have other enrollments that grant privileges to multiple sections in the same course.</p><br></li></ul>  |
| ```enrollment[notify]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>If true, a notification will be sent to the enrolled user. Notifications are not sent by default.</p>  |
| ```enrollment[self_enrollment_code]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>If the current user is not allowed to manage enrollments in this course, but the course allows self-enrollment, the user can self- enroll as a student in the default section by passing in a valid code. When self-enrolling, the user_id must be ‘self’. The enrollment_state will be set to ‘active’ and all other arguments will be ignored.</p>  |
| ```enrollment[self_enrolled]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>If true, marks the enrollment as a self-enrollment, which gives students the ability to drop the course if desired. Defaults to false.</p>  |
| ```enrollment[associated_user_id]``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>For an observer enrollment, the ID of a student to observe. This is a one-off operation; to automatically observe all a student’s enrollments (for example, as a parent), please use the <a href="user_observees.md#method.user_observees.create" title="User Observees API">User Observees API</a>.</p>  |
| ```enrollment[sis_user_id]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Required if the user is being enrolled from another trusted account. The unique identifier for the user (sis_user_id) must also be accompanied by the root_account parameter. The user_id will be ignored.</p>  |
| ```enrollment[integration_id]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Required if the user is being enrolled from another trusted account. The unique identifier for the user (integration_id) must also be accompanied by the root_account parameter. The user_id will be ignored.</p>  |
| ```root_account``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The domain of the account to search for the user. Will be a no-op unless the sis_user_id or integration_id parameter is also included.</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl https://<canvas>/api/v1/courses/:course_id/enrollments \
  -X POST \
  -F 'enrollment[user_id]=1' \
  -F 'enrollment[type]=StudentEnrollment' \
  -F 'enrollment[enrollment_state]=active' \
  -F 'enrollment[course_section_id]=1' \
  -F 'enrollment[limit_privileges_to_course_section]=true' \
  -F 'enrollment[notify]=false'
```
    

```bash
curl https://<canvas>/api/v1/courses/:course_id/enrollments \
  -X POST \
  -F 'enrollment[user_id]=2' \
  -F 'enrollment[type]=StudentEnrollment'
```
    


Returns an
 [Enrollment](enrollments.md#enrollment) object.

[ErrorsController#create](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/errors_controller.rb)







  
#### `POST /api/v1/error_reports`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/error_reports`


<p>Create a new error report documenting an experienced problem</p>

<p>Performs the same action as when a user uses the “help -&gt; report a problem” dialog.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```error[subject]``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>The summary of the problem</p>  |
| ```error[url]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>URL from which the report was issued</p>  |
| ```error[email]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Email address for the reporting user</p>  |
| ```error[comments]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The long version of the story from the user one what they experienced</p>  |
| ```error[http_env]``` |  ```SerializedHash``` |  <p>A collection of metadata about the users’ environment.  If not provided, canvas will collect it based on information found in the request. (Doesn’t have to be HTTPENV info, could be anything JSON object that can be serialized as a hash, a mobile app might include relevant metadata for itself)</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
# Create error report
curl 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/error_reports' \
      -X POST \
      -F 'error[subject]="things are broken"' \
      -F 'error[url]=http://<canvas>/courses/1' \
      -F 'error[description]="All my thoughts on what I saw"' \
      -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'
```

  ## [Get a sessionless launch url for an external tool.](#method.external_tools.generate_sessionless_launch)<a name='method.external_tools.generate_sessionless_launch'></a>


[ExternalToolsController#generate_sessionless_launch](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/external_tools_controller.rb)







  
#### `GET /api/v1/courses/:course_id/external_tools/sessionless_launch`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/external_tools/sessionless_launch`

  
#### `GET /api/v1/accounts/:account_id/external_tools/sessionless_launch`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/accounts/:account_id/external_tools/sessionless_launch`


<p>Returns a sessionless launch url for an external tool. Prefers the resource_link_lookup_uuid, but defaults to the other passed</p>

<pre class="code ruby"><code class="ruby">parameters id, url, and launch_type
</code></pre>

<p>NOTE: Either the resource_link_lookup_uuid, id, or url must be provided unless launch_type is assessment or module_item.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```id``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The external id of the tool to launch.</p>  |
| ```url``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The LTI launch url for the external tool.</p>  |
| ```assignment_id``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The assignment id for an assignment launch. Required if launch_type is set to “assessment”.</p>  |
| ```module_item_id``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The assignment id for a module item launch. Required if launch_type is set to “module_item”.</p>  |
| ```launch_type``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The type of launch to perform on the external tool. Placement names (eg. “course_navigation”) can also be specified to use the custom launch url for that placement; if done, the tool id must be provided.</p>  Allowed values: `assessment`, `module_item`  |
| ```resource_link_lookup_uuid``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The identifier to lookup a resource link.</p>  |

#### API response field:


-  id


  
<p>The id for the external tool to be launched.</p>



-  name


  
<p>The name of the external tool to be launched.</p>



-  url


  
<p>The url to load to launch the external tool for the user.</p>




#### Example Request:
    

```bash
Finds the tool by id and returns a sessionless launch url
curl 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/courses/<course_id>/external_tools/sessionless_launch' \
     -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
     -F 'id=<external_tool_id>'
```
    

```bash
Finds the tool by launch url and returns a sessionless launch url
curl 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/courses/<course_id>/external_tools/sessionless_launch' \
     -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
     -F 'url=<lti launch url>'
```
    

```bash
Finds the tool associated with a specific assignment and returns a sessionless launch url
curl 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/courses/<course_id>/external_tools/sessionless_launch' \
     -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
     -F 'launch_type=assessment' \
     -F 'assignment_id=<assignment_id>'
```
    

```bash
Finds the tool associated with a specific module item and returns a sessionless launch url
curl 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/courses/<course_id>/external_tools/sessionless_launch' \
     -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
     -F 'launch_type=module_item' \
     -F 'module_item_id=<module_item_id>'
```
    

```bash
Finds the tool by id and returns a sessionless launch url for a specific placement
curl 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/courses/<course_id>/external_tools/sessionless_launch' \
     -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
     -F 'id=<external_tool_id>' \
     -F 'launch_type=<placement_name>'
```

#### `GET /api/v1/courses/:course_id/external_tools/:external_tool_id`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/external_tools/:external_tool_id`

  
#### `GET /api/v1/accounts/:account_id/external_tools/:external_tool_id`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/accounts/:account_id/external_tools/:external_tool_id`


<p>Returns the specified external tool.</p>

#### API response field:


-  id


  
<p>The unique identifier for the tool</p>



-  domain


  
<p>The domain to match links against</p>



-  url


  
<p>The url to match links against</p>



-  consumer_key


  
<p>The consumer key used by the tool (The associated shared secret is not returned)</p>



-  name


  
<p>The name of the tool</p>



-  description


  
<p>A description of the tool</p>



-  created_at


  
<p>Timestamp of creation</p>



-  updated_at


  
<p>Timestamp of last update</p>



-  privacy_level


  
<p>How much user information to send to the external tool: “anonymous”, “name_only”, “email_only”, “public”</p>



-  custom_fields


  
<p>Custom fields that will be sent to the tool consumer</p>



-  is_rce_favorite


  
<p>Boolean determining whether this tool should be in a preferred location in the RCE.</p>



-  is_top_nav_favorite


  
<p>Boolean determining whether this tool should have a dedicated button in Top Navigation.</p>



-  account_navigation


  
<p>The configuration for account navigation links (see create API for values)</p>



-  assignment_selection


  
<p>The configuration for assignment selection links (see create API for values)</p>



-  course_home_sub_navigation


  
<p>The configuration for course home navigation links (see create API for values)</p>



-  course_navigation


  
<p>The configuration for course navigation links (see create API for values)</p>



-  editor_button


  
<p>The configuration for a WYSIWYG editor button (see create API for values)</p>



-  homework_submission


  
<p>The configuration for homework submission selection (see create API for values)</p>



-  link_selection


  
<p>The configuration for link selection (see create API for values)</p>



-  migration_selection


  
<p>The configuration for migration selection (see create API for values)</p>



-  resource_selection


  
<p>The configuration for a resource selector in modules (see create API for values)</p>



-  tool_configuration


  
<p>The configuration for a tool configuration link (see create API for values)</p>



-  user_navigation


  
<p>The configuration for user navigation links (see create API for values)</p>



-  selection_width


  
<p>The pixel width of the iFrame that the tool will be rendered in</p>



-  selection_height


  
<p>The pixel height of the iFrame that the tool will be rendered in</p>



-  icon_url


  
<p>The url for the tool icon</p>



-  not_selectable


  
<p>whether the tool is not selectable from assignment and modules</p>



-  unified_tool_id


  
<p>The unique identifier for the tool in LearnPlatform</p>



-  deployment_id


  
<p>The unique identifier for the deployment of the tool</p>

  ## [Create an external tool](#method.external_tools.create)<a name='method.external_tools.create'></a>


[ExternalToolsController#create](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/external_tools_controller.rb)







  
#### `POST /api/v1/courses/:course_id/external_tools`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/external_tools`

  
#### `POST /api/v1/accounts/:account_id/external_tools`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/accounts/:account_id/external_tools`


<p>Create an external tool in the specified course/account. The created tool will be returned, see the “show” endpoint for an example. If a client ID is supplied canvas will attempt to create a context external tool using the LTI 1.3 standard.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```client_id``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>The client id is attached to the developer key. If supplied all other parameters are unnecessary and will be ignored</p>  |
| ```name``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>The name of the tool</p>  |
| ```privacy_level``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>How much user information to send to the external tool.</p>  Allowed values: `anonymous`, `name_only`, `email_only`, `public`  |
| ```consumer_key``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>The consumer key for the external tool</p>  |
| ```shared_secret``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>The shared secret with the external tool</p>  |
| ```description``` |  ```string``` |  <p>A description of the tool</p>  |
| ```url``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The url to match links against. Either “url” or “domain” should be set, not both.</p>  |
| ```domain``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The domain to match links against. Either “url” or “domain” should be set, not both.</p>  |
| ```icon_url``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The url of the icon to show for this tool</p>  |
| ```text``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The default text to show for this tool</p>  |
| ```custom_fields[field_name]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Custom fields that will be sent to the tool consumer; can be used multiple times</p>  |
| ```is_rce_favorite``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>(Deprecated in favor of <a href="external_tools.md#method.external_tools.add_rce_favorite" title="Add tool to RCE Favorites">Add tool to RCE Favorites</a> and <a href="external_tools.md#method.external_tools.remove_rce_favorite" title="Remove tool from RCE Favorites">Remove tool from RCE Favorites</a>) Whether this tool should appear in a preferred location in the RCE. This only applies to tools in root account contexts that have an editor button placement.</p>  |
| ```account_navigation[url]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The url of the external tool for account navigation</p>  |
| ```account_navigation[enabled]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Set this to enable this feature</p>  |
| ```account_navigation[text]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The text that will show on the left-tab in the account navigation</p>  |
| ```account_navigation[selection_width]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The width of the dialog the tool is launched in</p>  |
| ```account_navigation[selection_height]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The height of the dialog the tool is launched in</p>  |
| ```account_navigation[display_type]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The layout type to use when launching the tool. Must be “full_width”, “full_width_in_context”, “in_nav_context”, “borderless”, or “default”</p>  |
| ```user_navigation[url]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The url of the external tool for user navigation</p>  |
| ```user_navigation[enabled]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Set this to enable this feature</p>  |
| ```user_navigation[text]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The text that will show on the left-tab in the user navigation</p>  |
| ```user_navigation[visibility]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Who will see the navigation tab. “admins” for admins, “public” or “members” for everyone. Setting this to ‘null` will remove this configuration and use the default behavior, which is “public”.</p>  Allowed values: `admins`, `members`, `public`  |
| ```course_home_sub_navigation[url]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The url of the external tool for right-side course home navigation menu</p>  |
| ```course_home_sub_navigation[enabled]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Set this to enable this feature</p>  |
| ```course_home_sub_navigation[text]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The text that will show on the right-side course home navigation menu</p>  |
| ```course_home_sub_navigation[icon_url]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The url of the icon to show in the right-side course home navigation menu</p>  |
| ```course_navigation[enabled]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Set this to enable this feature</p>  |
| ```course_navigation[text]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The text that will show on the left-tab in the course navigation</p>  |
| ```course_navigation[visibility]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Who will see the navigation tab. “admins” for course admins, “members” for students, “public” for everyone. Setting this to ‘null` will remove this configuration and use the default behavior, which is “public”.</p>  Allowed values: `admins`, `members`, `public`  |
| ```course_navigation[windowTarget]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Determines how the navigation tab will be opened. “_blank”	Launches the external tool in a new window or tab. “_self”	(Default) Launches the external tool in an iframe inside of Canvas.</p>  Allowed values: `_blank`, `_self`  |
| ```course_navigation[default]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>If set to “disabled” the tool will not appear in the course navigation until a teacher explicitly enables it.</p><br><p>If set to “enabled” the tool will appear in the course navigation without requiring a teacher to explicitly enable it.</p><br><p>defaults to “enabled”</p>  Allowed values: `disabled`, `enabled`  |
| ```course_navigation[display_type]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The layout type to use when launching the tool. Must be “full_width”, “full_width_in_context”, “in_nav_context”, “borderless”, or “default”</p>  |
| ```editor_button[url]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The url of the external tool</p>  |
| ```editor_button[enabled]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Set this to enable this feature</p>  |
| ```editor_button[icon_url]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The url of the icon to show in the WYSIWYG editor</p>  |
| ```editor_button[selection_width]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The width of the dialog the tool is launched in</p>  |
| ```editor_button[selection_height]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The height of the dialog the tool is launched in</p>  |
| ```editor_button[message_type]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Set this to ContentItemSelectionRequest to tell the tool to use content-item; otherwise, omit</p>  |
| ```homework_submission[url]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The url of the external tool</p>  |
| ```homework_submission[enabled]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Set this to enable this feature</p>  |
| ```homework_submission[text]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The text that will show on the homework submission tab</p>  |
| ```homework_submission[message_type]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Set this to ContentItemSelectionRequest to tell the tool to use content-item; otherwise, omit</p>  |
| ```link_selection[url]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The url of the external tool</p>  |
| ```link_selection[enabled]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Set this to enable this feature</p>  |
| ```link_selection[text]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The text that will show for the link selection text</p>  |
| ```link_selection[message_type]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Set this to ContentItemSelectionRequest to tell the tool to use content-item; otherwise, omit</p>  |
| ```migration_selection[url]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The url of the external tool</p>  |
| ```migration_selection[enabled]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Set this to enable this feature</p>  |
| ```migration_selection[message_type]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Set this to ContentItemSelectionRequest to tell the tool to use content-item; otherwise, omit</p>  |
| ```tool_configuration[url]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The url of the external tool</p>  |
| ```tool_configuration[enabled]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Set this to enable this feature</p>  |
| ```tool_configuration[message_type]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Set this to ContentItemSelectionRequest to tell the tool to use content-item; otherwise, omit</p>  |
| ```tool_configuration[prefer_sis_email]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Set this to default the lis_person_contact_email_primary to prefer provisioned sis_email; otherwise, omit</p>  |
| ```resource_selection[url]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The url of the external tool</p>  |
| ```resource_selection[enabled]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Set this to enable this feature. If set to false, not_selectable must also be set to true in order to hide this tool from the selection UI in modules and assignments.</p>  |
| ```resource_selection[icon_url]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The url of the icon to show in the module external tool list</p>  |
| ```resource_selection[selection_width]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The width of the dialog the tool is launched in</p>  |
| ```resource_selection[selection_height]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The height of the dialog the tool is launched in</p>  |
| ```config_type``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Configuration can be passed in as CC xml instead of using query parameters. If this value is “by_url” or “by_xml” then an xml configuration will be expected in either the “config_xml” or “config_url” parameter. Note that the name parameter overrides the tool name provided in the xml</p>  |
| ```config_xml``` |  ```string``` |  <p>XML tool configuration, as specified in the CC xml specification. This is required if “config_type” is set to “by_xml”</p>  |
| ```config_url``` |  ```string``` |  <p>URL where the server can retrieve an XML tool configuration, as specified in the CC xml specification. This is required if “config_type” is set to “by_url”</p>  |
| ```not_selectable``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Default: false. If set to true, and if resource_selection is set to false, the tool won’t show up in the external tool selection UI in modules and assignments</p>  |
| ```oauth_compliant``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Default: false, if set to true LTI query params will not be copied to the post body.</p>  |
| ```unified_tool_id``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The unique identifier for the tool in LearnPlatform</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
This would create a tool on this course with two custom fields and a course navigation tab
curl -X POST 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/courses/<course_id>/external_tools' \
     -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
     -F 'name=LTI Example' \
     -F 'consumer_key=asdfg' \
     -F 'shared_secret=lkjh' \
     -F 'url=https://example.com/ims/lti' \
     -F 'privacy_level=name_only' \
     -F 'custom_fields[key1]=value1' \
     -F 'custom_fields[key2]=value2' \
     -F 'course_navigation[text]=Course Materials' \
     -F 'course_navigation[enabled]=true'
```
    

```bash
This would create a tool on the account with navigation for the user profile page
curl -X POST 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/accounts/<account_id>/external_tools' \
     -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
     -F 'name=LTI Example' \
     -F 'consumer_key=asdfg' \
     -F 'shared_secret=lkjh' \
     -F 'url=https://example.com/ims/lti' \
     -F 'privacy_level=name_only' \
     -F 'user_navigation[url]=https://example.com/ims/lti/user_endpoint' \
     -F 'user_navigation[text]=Something Cool'
     -F 'user_navigation[enabled]=true'
```
    

```bash
This would create a tool on the account with configuration pulled from an external URL
curl -X POST 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/accounts/<account_id>/external_tools' \
     -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
     -F 'name=LTI Example' \
     -F 'consumer_key=asdfg' \
     -F 'shared_secret=lkjh' \
     -F 'config_type=by_url' \
     -F 'config_url=https://example.com/ims/lti/tool_config.xml'
```

  ## [Get visible course navigation tools](#method.external_tools.all_visible_nav_tools)<a name='method.external_tools.all_visible_nav_tools'></a>

#### `GET /api/v1/external_tools/visible_course_nav_tools`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/external_tools/visible_course_nav_tools`


<p>Get a list of external tools with the course_navigation placement that have not been hidden in course settings and whose visibility settings apply to the requesting user. These tools are the same that appear in the course navigation.</p>

<p>The response format is the same as for List external tools, but with additional context_id and context_name fields on each element in the array.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```context_codes[]``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>List of context_codes to retrieve visible course nav tools for (for example, <code>course_123</code>). Only courses are presently supported.</p>  |

#### API response field:


-  context_id


  
<p>The unique identifier of the associated context</p>



-  context_name


  
<p>The name of the associated context</p>




#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/external_tools/visible_course_nav_tools?context_codes[]=course_5' \
     -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>"
```
    


#### Example Response:
    

```js
[{
  "id": 1,
  "domain": "domain.example.com",
  "url": "http://www.example.com/ims/lti",
  "context_id": 5,
  "context_name": "Example Course",
  ...
},
{ ...  }]
```

  ## [Set feature flag](#method.feature_flags.update)<a name='method.feature_flags.update'></a>


[FeatureFlagsController#update](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/feature_flags_controller.rb)







  
#### `PUT /api/v1/courses/:course_id/features/flags/:feature`
**Scope:** `url:PUT|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/features/flags/:feature`

  
#### `PUT /api/v1/accounts/:account_id/features/flags/:feature`
**Scope:** `url:PUT|/api/v1/accounts/:account_id/features/flags/:feature`

  
#### `PUT /api/v1/users/:user_id/features/flags/:feature`
**Scope:** `url:PUT|/api/v1/users/:user_id/features/flags/:feature`


<p>Set a feature flag for a given Account, Course, or User. This call will fail if a parent account sets a feature flag for the same feature in any state other than “allowed”.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```state``` |  ```string``` |  <br>- “off”<br><br>  The feature is not available for the course, user, or account and sub-accounts.<br><br><br>- “allowed”<br><br>  (valid only on accounts) The feature is off in the account, but may be enabled in sub-accounts and courses by setting a feature flag on the sub-account or course.<br><br><br>- “on”<br><br>  The feature is turned on unconditionally for the user, course, or account and sub-accounts.<br><br>  Allowed values: `off`, `allowed`, `on`  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl -X PUT 'http://<canvas>/api/v1/courses/1/features/flags/fancy_wickets' \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer " \
  -F "state=on"
```
    


Returns a
 [FeatureFlag](feature_flags.md#featureflag) object.

The object will then inherit the feature flags from a higher account, if any exist.  If this flag was ‘on’ or ‘off’, then lower-level account flags that were masked by this one will apply again.</p>

```bash

  -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>"
```

 [FeatureFlag](feature_flags.md#featureflag) object.
