#### `GET /api/v1/folders/:id/files`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/folders/:id/files`


<p>Returns the paginated list of files for the folder or course.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```content_types[]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Filter results by content-type. You can specify type/subtype pairs (e.g., ‘image/jpeg’), or simply types (e.g., ‘image’, which will match ‘image/gif’, ‘image/jpeg’, etc.).</p>  |
| ```exclude_content_types[]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Exclude given content-types from your results. You can specify type/subtype pairs (e.g., ‘image/jpeg’), or simply types (e.g., ‘image’, which will match ‘image/gif’, ‘image/jpeg’, etc.).</p>  |
| ```search_term``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The partial name of the files to match and return.</p>  |
| ```include[]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Array of additional information to include.</p><br><br>- “user”<br><br>  the user who uploaded the file or last edited its content<br><br><br>- “usage_rights”<br><br>  copyright and license information for the file (see UsageRights)<br><br>  Allowed values: `user`  |
| ```only[]``` |  ```Array``` |  <p>Array of information to restrict to. Overrides include[]</p><br><br>- “names”<br><br>  only returns file name information<br><br>  |
| ```sort``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Sort results by this field. Defaults to ‘name’. Note that ‘sort=user` implies `include[]=user`.</p>  Allowed values: `name`, `size`, `created_at`, `updated_at`, `content_type`, `user`  |
| ```order``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The sorting order. Defaults to ‘asc’.</p>  Allowed values: `asc`, `desc`  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/folders/<folder_id>/files?content_types[]=image&content_types[]=text/plain \
      -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'
```
    


Returns a list of
 [File](plagiarism_detection_submissions.md#file) objects.

#### `PUT /api/v1/files/:id`
**Scope:** `url:PUT|/api/v1/files/:id`


<p>Update some settings on the specified file</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```name``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The new display name of the file, with a limit of 255 characters.</p>  |
| ```parent_folder_id``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The id of the folder to move this file into. The new folder must be in the same context as the original parent folder. If the file is in a context without folders this does not apply.</p>  |
| ```on_duplicate``` |  ```string``` |  <p>If the file is moved to a folder containing a file with the same name, or renamed to a name matching an existing file, the API call will fail unless this parameter is supplied.</p><br><br>- “overwrite”<br><br>  Replace the existing file with the same name<br><br><br>- “rename”<br><br>  Add a qualifier to make the new filename unique<br><br>  Allowed values: `overwrite`, `rename`  |
| ```lock_at``` |  ```DateTime``` |  <p>The datetime to lock the file at</p>  |
| ```unlock_at``` |  ```DateTime``` |  <p>The datetime to unlock the file at</p>  |
| ```locked``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Flag the file as locked</p>  |
| ```hidden``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Flag the file as hidden</p>  |
| ```visibility_level``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Configure which roles can access this file</p>  |


**Scope:** `url:DELETE|/api/v1/files/:id`


<p>Remove the specified file. Unlike most other DELETE endpoints, using this endpoint will result in comprehensive, irretrievable destruction of the file. It should be used with the ‘replace` parameter set to true in cases where the file preview also needs to be destroyed (such as to remove files that violate privacy laws).</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```replace``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>This action is irreversible. If replace is set to true the file contents will be replaced with a generic “file has been removed” file. This also destroys any previews that have been generated for the file. Must have manage files and become other users permissions</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl -X DELETE 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/files/<file_id>' \
     -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'
```
    


Returns a
 [File](plagiarism_detection_submissions.md#file) object.

 [Folder](files.md#folder) object.

**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/accounts/:account_id/folders`


<p>Creates a folder in the specified context</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```name``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>The name of the folder</p>  |
| ```parent_folder_id``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The id of the folder to store the new folder in. An error will be returned if this does not correspond to an existing folder. If this and parent_folder_path are sent an error will be returned. If neither is given, a default folder will be used.</p>  |

The parent folder will be created if it does not already exist. This parameter only applies to new folders in a context that has folders, such as a user, a course, or a group. If this and parent_folder_id are sent an error will be returned. If neither is given, a default folder will be used.</p>  |
| ```lock_at``` |  ```DateTime``` |  <p>The datetime to lock the folder at</p>  |
| ```unlock_at``` |  ```DateTime``` |  <p>The datetime to unlock the folder at</p>  |
| ```locked``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Flag the folder as locked</p>  |
| ```hidden``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Flag the folder as hidden</p>  |
| ```position``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>Set an explicit sort position for the folder</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/folders/<folder_id>/folders' \
     -F 'name=<new_name>' \
     -F 'locked=true' \
     -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'
```

```bash
     -F 'name=<new_name>' \
     -F 'locked=true' \
     -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'
```

  ## [Copy a file](#method.folders.copy_file)<a name='method.folders.copy_file'></a>

#### `POST /api/v1/folders/:dest_folder_id/copy_file`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/folders/:dest_folder_id/copy_file`


<p>Copy a file from elsewhere in Canvas into a folder.</p>

<p>Copying a file across contexts (between courses and users) is permitted, but the source and destination must belong to the same institution.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```source_file_id``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>The id of the source file</p>  |
| ```on_duplicate``` |  ```string``` |  <p>What to do if a file with the same name already exists at the destination. If such a file exists and this parameter is not given, the call will fail.</p><br><br>- “overwrite”<br><br>  Replace an existing file with the same name<br><br><br>- “rename”<br><br>  Add a qualifier to make the new filename unique<br><br>  Allowed values: `overwrite`, `rename`  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/folders/123/copy_file' \
     -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'
     -F 'source_file_id=456'
```
    


Returns a
 [File](plagiarism_detection_submissions.md#file) object.

```bash
curl 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/folders/123/copy_folder' \
     -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'
     -F 'source_file_id=789'
```

 [Folder](files.md#folder) object.

#### `GET /api/v1/audit/grade_change`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/audit/grade_change`


<p>List grade change events satisfying all given parameters. Teachers may query for events in courses they teach. Queries without <code>course_id</code> require account administrator rights.</p>

<p>At least one of <code>course_id</code>, <code>assignment_id</code>, <code>student_id</code>, or <code>grader_id</code> must be specified.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```course_id``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>Restrict query to events in the specified course.</p>  |
| ```assignment_id``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>Restrict query to the given assignment. If “override” is given, query the course final grade override instead.</p>  |
| ```student_id``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>User id of a student to search grading events for.</p>  |
| ```grader_id``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>User id of a grader to search grading events for.</p>  |
| ```start_time``` |  ```DateTime``` |  <p>The beginning of the time range from which you want events.</p>  |
| ```end_time``` |  ```DateTime``` |  <p>The end of the time range from which you want events.</p>  |



Returns a list of
 [GradeChangeEvent](grade_change_log.md#gradechangeevent) objects.

  ## [Create a new grading standard](#method.grading_standards_api.create)<a name='method.grading_standards_api.create'></a>


[GradingStandardsApiController#create](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/grading_standards_api_controller.rb)







  
#### `POST /api/v1/accounts/:account_id/grading_standards`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/accounts/:account_id/grading_standards`

  
#### `POST /api/v1/courses/:course_id/grading_standards`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/grading_standards`


<p>Create a new grading standard</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```title``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>The title for the Grading Standard.</p>  |
| ```grading_scheme_entry[][name]``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>The name for an entry value within a GradingStandard that describes the range of the value e.g. A-</p>  |
| ```grading_scheme_entry[][value]``` | Required ```integer``` |  <p>The value for the name of the entry within a GradingStandard. The entry represents the lower bound of the range for the entry. This range includes the value up to the next entry in the GradingStandard, or 100 if there is no upper bound. The lowest value will have a lower bound range of 0. e.g. 93</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl https://<canvas>/api/v1/courses/<course_id>/grading_standards \
  -X POST \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>' \
  -d 'title=New standard name' \
  -d 'grading_scheme_entry[][name]=A' \
  -d 'grading_scheme_entry[][value]=94' \
  -d 'grading_scheme_entry[][name]=A-' \
  -d 'grading_scheme_entry[][value]=90' \
  -d 'grading_scheme_entry[][name]=B+' \
  -d 'grading_scheme_entry[][value]=87' \
  -d 'grading_scheme_entry[][name]=B' \
  -d 'grading_scheme_entry[][value]=84' \
  -d 'grading_scheme_entry[][name]=B-' \
  -d 'grading_scheme_entry[][value]=80' \
  -d 'grading_scheme_entry[][name]=C+' \
  -d 'grading_scheme_entry[][value]=77' \
  -d 'grading_scheme_entry[][name]=C' \
  -d 'grading_scheme_entry[][value]=74' \
  -d 'grading_scheme_entry[][name]=C-' \
  -d 'grading_scheme_entry[][value]=70' \
  -d 'grading_scheme_entry[][name]=D+' \
  -d 'grading_scheme_entry[][value]=67' \
  -d 'grading_scheme_entry[][name]=D' \
  -d 'grading_scheme_entry[][value]=64' \
  -d 'grading_scheme_entry[][name]=D-' \
  -d 'grading_scheme_entry[][value]=61' \
  -d 'grading_scheme_entry[][name]=F' \
  -d 'grading_scheme_entry[][value]=0'
```
    


#### Example Response:
    

```js
{
  "title": "New standard name",
  "id": 1,
  "context_id": 1,
  "context_type": "Course",
  "grading_scheme": [
    {"name": "A", "value": 0.9},
    {"name": "B", "value": 0.8}
  ]
}
```
    

Returns a
 [GradingStandard](grading_standards.md#gradingstandard) object.

**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/accounts/:account_id/group_categories`

  
#### `POST /api/v1/courses/:course_id/group_categories`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/group_categories`


<p>Create a new group category</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```name``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>Name of the group category</p>  |
| ```self_signup``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Allow students to sign up for a group themselves (Course Only). valid values are:</p><br><br>- “enabled”<br><br>  allows students to self sign up for any group in course<br><br><br>- “restricted”<br><br>  allows students to self sign up only for groups in the same section null disallows self sign up<br><br>  Allowed values: `enabled`, `restricted`  |
| ```auto_leader``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Assigns group leaders automatically when generating and allocating students to groups Valid values are:</p><br><br>- “first”<br><br>  the first student to be allocated to a group is the leader<br><br><br>- “random”<br><br>  a random student from all members is chosen as the leader<br><br>  Allowed values: `first`, `random`  |
| ```group_limit``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>Limit the maximum number of users in each group (Course Only). Requires self signup.</p>  |
| ```sis_group_category_id``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The unique SIS identifier.</p>  |
| ```create_group_count``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>Create this number of groups (Course Only).</p>  |
| ```split_group_count``` |  ```string``` |  <p>(Deprecated) Create this number of groups, and evenly distribute students among them. not allowed with “enable_self_signup”. because the group assignment happens synchronously, it’s recommended that you instead use the assign_unassigned_members endpoint. (Course Only)</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl htps://<canvas>/api/v1/courses/<course_id>/group_categories \
    -F 'name=Project Groups' \
    -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'
```

 [GroupCategory](group_categories.md#groupcategory) object.



  ## [Import category groups](#method.group_categories.import)<a name='method.group_categories.import'></a>


[GroupCategoriesController#import](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/group_categories_controller.rb)







  
#### `POST /api/v1/group_categories/:group_category_id/import`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/group_categories/:group_category_id/import`


<p>Create Groups in a Group Category through a CSV import</p>

<p>For more information on the format that’s expected here, please see the “Group Category CSV” section in the API docs.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```attachment``` |  ```string``` |  <p>There are two ways to post group category import data - either via a multipart/form-data form-field-style attachment, or via a non-multipart raw post request.</p><br><p>‘attachment’ is required for multipart/form-data style posts. Assumed to be outcome data from a file upload form field named ‘attachment’.</p><br><p>Examples:</p><br><pre class="code ruby"><code class="ruby">curl -F attachment=@&lt;filename&gt; -H &quot;Authorization: Bearer &lt;token&gt;&quot; \<br>    &#39;https://&lt;canvas&gt;/api/v1/group_categories/&lt;category_id&gt;/import&#39;<br></code></pre><br><p>If you decide to do a raw post, you can skip the ‘attachment’ argument, but you will then be required to provide a suitable Content-Type header. You are encouraged to also provide the ‘extension’ argument.</p><br><p>Examples:</p><br><pre class="code ruby"><code class="ruby">curl -H &#39;Content-Type: text/csv&#39; --data-binary @&lt;filename&gt;.csv \<br>    -H &quot;Authorization: Bearer &lt;token&gt;&quot; \<br>    &#39;https://&lt;canvas&gt;/api/v1/group_categories/&lt;category_id&gt;/import&#39;<br></code></pre>  |



#### Example Response:
    

```js
# Progress (default)
{
    "completion": 0,
    "context_id": 20,
    "context_type": "GroupCategory",
    "created_at": "2013-07-05T10:57:48-06:00",
    "id": 2,
    "message": null,
    "tag": "course_group_import",
    "updated_at": "2013-07-05T10:57:48-06:00",
    "user_id": null,
    "workflow_state": "running",
    "url": "http://localhost:3000/api/v1/progress/2"
}
```
    

Returns a
 [Progress](progress.md#progress) object.



  ## [Update a Group Category](#method.group_categories.update)<a name='method.group_categories.update'></a>

#### `PUT /api/v1/group_categories/:group_category_id`
**Scope:** `url:PUT|/api/v1/group_categories/:group_category_id`


<p>Modifies an existing group category.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```name``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Name of the group category</p>  |
| ```self_signup``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Allow students to sign up for a group themselves (Course Only). Valid values are:</p><br><br>- “enabled”<br><br>  allows students to self sign up for any group in course<br><br><br>- “restricted”<br><br>  allows students to self sign up only for groups in the same section null disallows self sign up<br><br>  Allowed values: `enabled`, `restricted`  |
| ```auto_leader``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Assigns group leaders automatically when generating and allocating students to groups Valid values are:</p><br><br>- “first”<br><br>  the first student to be allocated to a group is the leader<br><br><br>- “random”<br><br>  a random student from all members is chosen as the leader<br><br>  Allowed values: `first`, `random`  |
| ```group_limit``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>Limit the maximum number of users in each group (Course Only). Requires self signup.</p>  |
| ```sis_group_category_id``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The unique SIS identifier.</p>  |
| ```create_group_count``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>Create this number of groups (Course Only).</p>  |
| ```split_group_count``` |  ```string``` |  <p>(Deprecated) Create this number of groups, and evenly distribute students among them. not allowed with “enable_self_signup”. because the group assignment happens synchronously, it’s recommended that you instead use the assign_unassigned_members endpoint. (Course Only)</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl https://<canvas>/api/v1/group_categories/<group_category_id> \
```

 [GroupCategory](group_categories.md#groupcategory) object.

#### `POST /api/v1/group_categories/:group_category_id/groups`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/group_categories/:group_category_id/groups`


<p>Creates a new group. Groups created using the “/api/v1/groups/” endpoint will be community groups.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```name``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The name of the group</p>  |
| ```description``` |  ```string``` |  <p>A description of the group</p>  |
| ```is_public``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>whether the group is public (applies only to community groups)</p>  |
| ```join_level``` |  ```string``` |  <p>no description</p>  Allowed values: `parent_context_auto_join`, `parent_context_request`, `invitation_only`  |
| ```storage_quota_mb``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>The allowed file storage for the group, in megabytes. This parameter is ignored if the caller does not have the manage_storage_quotas permission.</p>  |
| ```sis_group_id``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The sis ID of the group. Must have manage_sis permission to set.</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl https://<canvas>/api/v1/groups \
     -F 'name=Math Teachers' \
     -F 'description=A place to gather resources for our classes.' \
     -F 'is_public=true' \
     -F 'join_level=parent_context_auto_join' \
     -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'
```
    


Returns a
 [Group](groups.md#group) object.



  ## [Edit a group](#method.groups.update)<a name='method.groups.update'></a>


[GroupsController#update](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/groups_controller.rb)







  
#### `PUT /api/v1/groups/:group_id`
**Scope:** `url:PUT|/api/v1/groups/:group_id`


<p>Modifies an existing group.  Note that to set an avatar image for the group, you must first upload the image file to the group, and the use the id in the response as the argument to this function.  See the <a href="file_uploads.md" title="File Upload Documentation">File Upload Documentation</a> for details on the file upload workflow.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```name``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The name of the group</p>  |
| ```description``` |  ```string``` |  <p>A description of the group</p>  |
| ```is_public``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Whether the group is public (applies only to community groups). Currently you cannot set a group back to private once it has been made public.</p>  |
| ```join_level``` |  ```string``` |  <p>no description</p>  Allowed values: `parent_context_auto_join`, `parent_context_request`, `invitation_only`  |
| ```avatar_id``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>The id of the attachment previously uploaded to the group that you would like to use as the avatar image for this group.</p>  |
| ```storage_quota_mb``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>The allowed file storage for the group, in megabytes. This parameter is ignored if the caller does not have the manage_storage_quotas permission.</p>  |
| ```members[]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>An array of user ids for users you would like in the group. Users not in the group will be sent invitations. Existing group members who aren’t in the list will be removed from the group.</p>  |
| ```sis_group_id``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The sis ID of the group. Must have manage_sis permission to set.</p>  |
| ```override_sis_stickiness``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Default is true. If false, any fields containing “sticky” changes will not be updated. See SIS CSV Format documentation for information on which fields can have SIS stickiness</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl https://<canvas>/api/v1/groups/<group_id> \
     -X PUT \
     -F 'name=Algebra Teachers' \
     -F 'join_level=parent_context_request' \
     -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'
```
    


Returns a
 [Group](groups.md#group) object.

  ## [Create JWT](#method.jwts.create)<a name='method.jwts.create'></a>


[JwtsController#create](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/jwts_controller.rb)







  
#### `POST /api/v1/jwts`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/jwts`


<p>Create a unique jwt for using with other Canvas services</p>

<p>Generates a different JWT each time it’s called, each one expires after a short window (1 hour)</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```workflows[]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Adds additional data to the JWT to be used by the consuming service workflow</p>  |
| ```context_type``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The type of the context in case a specified workflow uses it to consuming the service. Case insensitive.</p>  Allowed values: `Course`, `User`, `Account`  |
| ```context_id``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>The id of the context in case a specified workflow uses it to consuming the service.</p>  |
| ```context_uuid``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The uuid of the context in case a specified workflow uses it to consuming the service.</p>  |
| ```canvas_audience``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Defaults to true. If false, the JWT will be signed, but not encrypted, for use in downstream services. The default encrypted behaviour can be used to talk to canvas itself.</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/jwts' \
      -X POST \
      -H "Accept: application/json" \
      -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'
```
    


Returns a
 [JWT](jw_ts.md#jwt) object.

|-----------|------|-------------|

```bash
curl 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/jwts/refresh' \
      -X POST \
      -H "Accept: application/json" \
      -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'
      -d 'jwt=<jwt>'
```

 [JWT](jw_ts.md#jwt) object.

**Scope:** `url:PUT|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/assignments/:assignment_id/date_details`

**Scope:** `url:PUT|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/quizzes/:quiz_id/date_details`

**Scope:** `url:PUT|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/discussion_topics/:discussion_topic_id/date_details`

  
#### `PUT /api/v1/courses/:course_id/pages/:url_or_id/date_details`
**Scope:** `url:PUT|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/pages/:url_or_id/date_details`

  
#### `PUT /api/v1/courses/:course_id/files/:attachment_id/date_details`
**Scope:** `url:PUT|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/files/:attachment_id/date_details`


<p>Updates date-related information for learning objects, including due date, availability dates, override status, and assignment overrides.</p>

<p>Returns 204 No Content response code if successful.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```due_at``` |  ```DateTime``` |  <p>The learning object’s due date. Not applicable for ungraded discussions, pages, and files.</p>  |
| ```unlock_at``` |  ```DateTime``` |  <p>The learning object’s unlock date. Must be before the due date if there is one.</p>  |
| ```lock_at``` |  ```DateTime``` |  <p>The learning object’s lock date. Must be after the due date if there is one.</p>  |
| ```only_visible_to_overrides``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Whether the learning object is only assigned to students who are targeted by an override.</p>  |
| ```assignment_overrides[]``` |  ```Array``` |  <p>List of overrides to apply to the learning object. Overrides that already exist should include an ID and will be updated if needed. New overrides will be created for overrides in the list without an ID. Overrides not included in the list will be deleted. Providing an empty list will delete all of the object’s overrides. Keys for each override object can include: ‘id’, ‘title’, ‘due_at’, ‘unlock_at’, ‘lock_at’, ‘student_ids’, and ‘course_section_id’, ‘course_id’, ‘noop_id’, and ‘unassign_item’.</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl https://<canvas>/api/v1/courses/:course_id/assignments/:assignment_id/date_details \
  -X PUT \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
        "due_at": "2012-07-01T23:59:00-06:00",
        "unlock_at": "2012-06-01T00:00:00-06:00",
        "lock_at": "2012-08-01T00:00:00-06:00",
        "only_visible_to_overrides": true,
        "assignment_overrides": [
          {
            "id": 212,
            "course_section_id": 3564
          },
          {
            "title": "an assignment override",
            "student_ids": [1, 2, 3]
          }
        ]
      }'
```
    




  ## [Create a Line Item](#method.lti/ims/line_items.create)<a name='method.lti/ims/line_items.create'></a>


[Lti::IMS::LineItemsController#create](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/lti/ims/line_items_controller.rb)







  
#### `POST /api/lti/courses/:course_id/line_items`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/lti/courses/:course_id/line_items`


<p>Create a new Line Item</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```scoreMaximum``` | Required ```number``` |  <p>The maximum score for the line item. Scores created for the Line Item may exceed this value.</p>  |
| ```label``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>The label for the Line Item. If no resourceLinkId is specified this value will also be used as the name of the placeholder assignment.</p>  |
| ```resourceId``` |  ```string``` |  <p>A Tool Provider specified id for the Line Item. Multiple line items may share the same resourceId within a given context.</p>  |
| ```tag``` |  ```string``` |  <p>A value used to qualify a line Item beyond its ids. Line Items may be queried by this value in the List endpoint. Multiple line items can share the same tag within a given context.</p>  |
| ```resourceLinkId``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The resource link id the Line Item should be attached to. This value should match the LTI id of the Canvas assignment associated with the tool.</p>  |
| ```startDateTime``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The ISO8601 date and time when the line item is made available. Corresponds to the assignment’s unlock_at date.</p>  |
| ```endDateTime``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The ISO8601 date and time when the line item stops receiving submissions. Corresponds to the assignment’s due_at date.</p>  |
| ```https://canvas.instructure.com/lti/submission_type``` |  ```object``` |  <p>(EXTENSION) - Optional block to set Assignment Submission Type when creating a new assignment is created.</p><br><br>- type - ‘none’ or ‘external_tool’external_tool_url - Submission URL only used when type: ‘external_tool’<br><br>  <br><br>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
{
  "scoreMaximum": 100.0,
  "label": "LineItemLabel1",
  "resourceId": 1,
  "tag": "MyTag",
  "resourceLinkId": "1",
  "startDateTime": "2022-01-31T22:23:11+0000",
  "endDateTime": "2022-02-07T22:23:11+0000",
  "https://canvas.instructure.com/lti/submission_type": {
    "type": "external_tool",
    "external_tool_url": "https://my.launch.url"
  }
}
```
    


Returns a
 [LineItem](line_items.md#lineitem) object.

  ## [Create a user login](#method.pseudonyms.create)<a name='method.pseudonyms.create'></a>


[PseudonymsController#create](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/pseudonyms_controller.rb)







  
#### `POST /api/v1/accounts/:account_id/logins`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/accounts/:account_id/logins`


<p>Create a new login for an existing user in the given account.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```user[id]``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>The ID of the user to create the login for.</p>  |
| ```login[unique_id]``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>The unique ID for the new login.</p>  |
| ```login[password]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The new login’s password.</p>  |
| ```login[sis_user_id]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>SIS ID for the login. To set this parameter, the caller must be able to manage SIS permissions on the account.</p>  |
| ```login[integration_id]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Integration ID for the login. To set this parameter, the caller must be able to manage SIS permissions on the account. The Integration ID is a secondary identifier useful for more complex SIS integrations.</p>  |
| ```login[authentication_provider_id]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The authentication provider this login is associated with. Logins associated with a specific provider can only be used with that provider. Legacy providers (LDAP, CAS, SAML) will search for logins associated with them, or unassociated logins. New providers will only search for logins explicitly associated with them. This can be the integer ID of the provider, or the type of the provider (in which case, it will find the first matching provider).</p>  |
| ```login[declared_user_type]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The declared intention of the user type. This can be set, but does not change any Canvas functionality with respect to their access. A user can still be a teacher, admin, student, etc. in any particular context without regard to this setting. This can be used for administrative purposes for integrations to be able to more easily identify why the user was created. Valid values are:</p><br><pre class="code ruby"><code class="ruby">* administrative<br>* observer<br>* staff<br>* student<br>* student_other<br>* teacher<br></code></pre>  |
| ```user[existing_user_id]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>A Canvas User ID to identify a user in a trusted account (alternative to ‘id`, `existing_sis_user_id`, or `existing_integration_id`). This parameter is not available in OSS Canvas.</p>  |
| ```user[existing_integration_id]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>An Integration ID to identify a user in a trusted account (alternative to ‘id`, `existing_user_id`, or `existing_sis_user_id`). This parameter is not available in OSS Canvas.</p>  |
| ```user[existing_sis_user_id]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>An SIS User ID to identify a user in a trusted account (alternative to ‘id`, `existing_integration_id`, or `existing_user_id`). This parameter is not available in OSS Canvas.</p>  |
| ```user[trusted_account]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The domain of the account to search for the user. This field is required when identifying a user in a trusted account. This parameter is not available in OSS Canvas.</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
#create a facebook login for user with ID 123
curl 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/accounts/<account_id>/logins' \
     -F 'user[id]=123' \
     -F 'login[unique_id]=112233445566' \
     -F 'login[authentication_provider_id]=facebook' \
     -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'
```
    

```bash
#create a login for user in another trusted account:
curl 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/accounts/<account_id>/logins' \
     -F 'user[existing_user_sis_id]=SIS42' \
     -F 'user[trusted_account]=canvas.example.edu' \
     -F 'login[unique_id]=112233445566' \
     -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'
```
    




  ## [Edit a user login](#method.pseudonyms.update)<a name='method.pseudonyms.update'></a>


[PseudonymsController#update](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/pseudonyms_controller.rb)







  
#### `PUT /api/v1/accounts/:account_id/logins/:id`
**Scope:** `url:PUT|/api/v1/accounts/:account_id/logins/:id`


<p>Update an existing login for a user in the given account.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```login[unique_id]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The new unique ID for the login.</p>  |
| ```login[password]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The new password for the login. Can only be set by an admin user if admins are allowed to change passwords for the account.</p>  |
| ```login[sis_user_id]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>SIS ID for the login. To set this parameter, the caller must be able to manage SIS permissions on the account.</p>  |
| ```login[integration_id]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Integration ID for the login. To set this parameter, the caller must be able to manage SIS permissions on the account. The Integration ID is a secondary identifier useful for more complex SIS integrations.</p>  |
| ```login[authentication_provider_id]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The authentication provider this login is associated with. Logins associated with a specific provider can only be used with that provider. Legacy providers (LDAP, CAS, SAML) will search for logins associated with them, or unassociated logins. New providers will only search for logins explicitly associated with them. This can be the integer ID of the provider, or the type of the provider (in which case, it will find the first matching provider).</p>  |
| ```login[workflow_state]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Used to suspend or re-activate a login.</p>  Allowed values: `active`, `suspended`  |
| ```login[declared_user_type]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The declared intention of the user type. This can be set, but does not change any Canvas functionality with respect to their access. A user can still be a teacher, admin, student, etc. in any particular context without regard to this setting. This can be used for administrative purposes for integrations to be able to more easily identify why the user was created. Valid values are:</p><br><pre class="code ruby"><code class="ruby">* administrative<br>* observer<br>* staff<br>* student<br>* student_other<br>* teacher<br></code></pre>  |
| ```override_sis_stickiness``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Default is true. If false, any fields containing “sticky” changes will not be updated. See SIS CSV Format documentation for information on which fields can have SIS stickiness</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl https://<canvas>/api/v1/accounts/:account_id/logins/:login_id \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer <ACCESS-TOKEN>" \
  -X PUT
```
    


#### Example Response:
    

```js
{
  "id": 1,
  "user_id": 2,
  "account_id": 3,
  "unique_id": "bieber@example.com",
  "created_at": "2020-01-29T19:33:35Z",
  "sis_user_id": null,
  "integration_id": null,
  "authentication_provider_id": null,
  "workflow_state": "active",
  "declared_user_type": "teacher"
}
```

#### `GET /api/v1/courses/:course_id/lti_resource_links`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/lti_resource_links`


<p>Returns all Resource Links in the specified course. This includes links that are associated with Assignments, Module Items, Collaborations, and that are embedded in rich content. This endpoint is paginated, and will return 50 links per page by default. Links are sorted by the order in which they were created.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```include_deleted``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Include deleted resource links and links associated with deleted content in response. Default is false.</p>  |
| ```per_page``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>The number of registrations to return per page. Defaults to 50.</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
This would return the first 50 LTI resource links for the course, with a Link header pointing to the next page
curl -X GET 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/courses/<course_id>/lti_resource_links' \
    -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>" \
```
    


Returns a list of
 [Lti::ResourceLink](lti_resource_links.md#lti::resourcelink) objects.

  ## [List modules](#method.context_modules_api.index)<a name='method.context_modules_api.index'></a>

#### `GET /api/v1/courses/:course_id/modules`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/modules`


<p>A paginated list of the modules in a course</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```include[]``` |  ```string``` |  <ul><li><br><p>“items”: Return module items inline if possible. This parameter suggests that Canvas return module items directly in the Module object JSON, to avoid having to make separate API requests for each module when enumerating modules and items. Canvas is free to omit ‘items’ for any particular module if it deems them too numerous to return inline. Callers must be prepared to use the <a href="modules.md#method.context_module_items_api.index" title="List Module Items API">List Module Items API</a> if items are not returned.</p><br></li><li><br><p>“content_details”: Requires ‘items’. Returns additional details with module items specific to their associated content items. Includes standard lock information for each item.</p><br></li></ul>  Allowed values: `items`, `content_details`  |
| ```search_term``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The partial name of the modules (and module items, if ‘items’ is specified with include[]) to match and return.</p>  |
| ```student_id``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Returns module completion information for the student with this id.</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>' \
     https://<canvas>/api/v1/courses/222/modules
```
    


Returns a list of
 [Module](modules.md#module) objects.

#### `POST /api/v1/courses/:course_id/modules`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/modules`


<p>Create and return a new module</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```module[name]``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>The name of the module</p>  |
| ```module[unlock_at]``` |  ```DateTime``` |  <p>The date the module will unlock</p>  |
| ```module[position]``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>The position of this module in the course (1-based)</p>  |
| ```module[require_sequential_progress]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Whether module items must be unlocked in order</p>  |
| ```module[prerequisite_module_ids][]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>IDs of Modules that must be completed before this one is unlocked. Prerequisite modules must precede this module (i.e. have a lower position value), otherwise they will be ignored</p>  |

```bash
  -X POST \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>' \
  -d 'module[name]=module' \
  -d 'module[position]=2' \
  -d 'module[prerequisite_module_ids][]=121' \
  -d 'module[prerequisite_module_ids][]=122'
```
    


Returns a
 [Module](modules.md#module) object.

  ## [Create a module item](#method.context_module_items_api.create)<a name='method.context_module_items_api.create'></a>


[ContextModuleItemsApiController#create](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/context_module_items_api_controller.rb)







  
#### `POST /api/v1/courses/:course_id/modules/:module_id/items`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/modules/:module_id/items`


<p>Create and return a new module item</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```module_item[title]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The name of the module item and associated content</p>  |
| ```module_item[type]``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>The type of content linked to the item</p>  Allowed values: `File`, `Page`, `Discussion`, `Assignment`, `Quiz`, `SubHeader`, `ExternalUrl`, `ExternalTool`  |
| ```module_item[content_id]``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>The id of the content to link to the module item. Required, except for ‘ExternalUrl’, ‘Page’, and ‘SubHeader’ types.</p>  |
| ```module_item[position]``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>The position of this item in the module (1-based).</p>  |
| ```module_item[indent]``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>0-based indent level; module items may be indented to show a hierarchy</p>  |
| ```module_item[page_url]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Suffix for the linked wiki page (e.g. ‘front-page’). Required for ‘Page’ type.</p>  |
| ```module_item[external_url]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>External url that the item points to. [Required for ‘ExternalUrl’ and ‘ExternalTool’ types.</p>  |
| ```module_item[new_tab]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Whether the external tool opens in a new tab. Only applies to ‘ExternalTool’ type.</p>  |
| ```module_item[completion_requirement][type]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Completion requirement for this module item. “must_view”: Applies to all item types “must_contribute”: Only applies to “Assignment”, “Discussion”, and “Page” types “must_submit”, “min_score”: Only apply to “Assignment” and “Quiz” types “must_mark_done”: Only applies to “Assignment” and “Page” types Inapplicable types will be ignored</p>  Allowed values: `must_view`, `must_contribute`, `must_submit`, `must_mark_done`  |
| ```module_item[completion_requirement][min_score]``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>Minimum score required to complete. Required for completion_requirement type ‘min_score’.</p>  |
| ```module_item[iframe][width]``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>Width of the ExternalTool on launch</p>  |
| ```module_item[iframe][height]``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>Height of the ExternalTool on launch</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl https://<canvas>/api/v1/courses/<course_id>/modules/<module_id>/items \
  -X POST \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>' \
  -d 'module_item[title]=module item' \
  -d 'module_item[type]=ExternalTool' \
  -d 'module_item[content_id]=10' \
  -d 'module_item[position]=2' \
  -d 'module_item[indent]=1' \
  -d 'module_item[new_tab]=true' \
  -d 'module_item[iframe][width]=300' \
  -d 'module_item[iframe][height]=200'
```
    


Returns a
 [ModuleItem](modules.md#moduleitem) object.

| Parameter | Type | Description |

```bash
          {
            "id": 212,
            "course_section_id": 3564
          },
          {
            "title": "an assignment override",

          }
        ]
      }'
```

  ## [Create a quiz item](#method.new_quizzes/quiz_items_api.create)<a name='method.new_quizzes/quiz_items_api.create'></a>








  
#### `POST /api/quiz/v1/courses/:course_id/quizzes/:assignment_id/items`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/quiz/v1/courses/:course_id/quizzes/:assignment_id/items`


<p>Create a quiz item in a new quiz. Only <code>QuestionItem</code> types can be created.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```course_id``` | Required ```integer``` |  <p>no description</p>  |
| ```assignment_id``` | Required ```integer``` |  <p>The id of the assignment associated with the quiz.</p>  |
| ```item[position]``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>The position of the item within the quiz.</p>  |
| ```item[points_possible]``` |  ```number``` |  <p>The number of points available to score on this item. Must be positive.</p>  |
| ```item[entry_type]``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>The type of the item.</p>  Allowed values: `Item`  |
| ```item[entry][title]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The question title.</p>  |
| ```item[entry][item_body]``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>The question stem (rich content).</p>  |
| ```item[entry][calculator_type]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Type of calculator the user will have access to during the question.</p>  Allowed values: `none`, `basic`, `scientific`  |
| ```item[entry][feedback][neutral]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>General feedback to show regardless of answer (rich content).</p>  |
| ```item[entry][feedback][correct]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Feedback to show if the question is answered correctly (rich content).</p>  |
| ```item[entry][feedback][incorrect]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Feedback to show if the question is answered incorrectly (rich content).</p>  |
| ```item[entry][interaction_type_slug]``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>The type of question. One of ‘multi-answer’, ‘matching’, ‘categorization’, ‘file-upload’, ‘formula’, ‘ordering’, ‘rich-fill-blank’, ‘hot-spot’, ‘choice’, ‘numeric’, ‘true-false’, or ‘essay’. See <a href="new_quiz_items.md#Question+Types-appendix" title="Appendix: Question Types">Appendix: Question Types</a> for more info about each type.</p>  |
| ```item[entry][interaction_data]``` | Required ```Object``` |  <p>An object that contains the question data. See <a href="new_quiz_items.md#Question+Types-appendix" title="Appendix: Question Types">Appendix: Question Types</a> for more info about this field.</p>  |
| ```item[entry][properties]``` |  ```Object``` |  <p>An object that contains additional properties for some question types. See <a href="new_quiz_items.md#Question+Types-appendix" title="Appendix: Question Types">Appendix: Question Types</a> for more info about this field.</p>  |
| ```item[entry][scoring_data]``` | Required ```Object``` |  <p>An object that describes how to score the question. See <a href="new_quiz_items.md#Question+Types-appendix" title="Appendix: Question Types">Appendix: Question Types</a> for more info about this field.</p>  |
| ```item[entry][answer_feedback]``` |  ```Object``` |  <p>Feedback provided for each answer (rich content, only available on ‘choice’ question types).</p>  |
| ```item[entry][scoring_algorithm]``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>The algorithm used to score the question. See <a href="new_quiz_items.md#Question+Types-appendix" title="Appendix: Question Types">Appendix: Question Types</a> for more info about this field.</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl 'https://<canvas>/api/quiz/v1/courses/1/quizzes/12/items' \
     -X POST \
     -H 'Authorization Bearer <token>' \
     -d 'item[position]=1' \
     -d 'item[points_possible]=25.0' \
     -d 'item[properties]={}' \
     -d 'item[entry_type]=Item' \
     -d 'item[entry][title]=Question 1' \
     -d 'item[entry][feedback][correct]=good job!' \
     -d 'item[entry][calculator_type]=none' \
     -d 'item[entry][interaction_data][word_limit_enabled]=true' \
     -d 'item[entry][item_body]=<p>What is 3 ^ 6?</p>' \
     -d 'item[entry][interaction_type_slug]=essay' \
     -d 'item[entry][scoring_data][value]=' \
     -d 'item[entry][scoring_algorithm]=None'
```
    


Returns a
 [QuizItem](new_quiz_items.md#quizitem) object.

| ```quiz[quiz_settings][multiple_attempts][max_attempts]``` |  ```Positive Integer``` |  <p>The allowed attempts a student can take. If null, the allowed attempts are unlimited.  Only used if attempt_limit is true.</p>  |
| ```quiz[quiz_settings][multiple_attempts][score_to_keep]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Whichever score to keep for the attempts.  Only used if multiple_attempts_enabled is true.</p>  Allowed values: `average`, `first`, `highest`, `latest`  |
| ```quiz[quiz_settings][multiple_attempts][cooling_period]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Whether there is a cooling (waiting) period.  Only used if multiple_attempts_enabled is true.</p>  |
| ```quiz[quiz_settings][multiple_attempts][cooling_period_seconds]``` |  ```Positive Integer``` |  <p>Required waiting period in seconds between attempts. If null, there is no required time. Only used if cooling_period is true</p>  |
| ```quiz[quiz_settings][one_at_a_time_type]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Specifies the settings for questions to display when quiz taking.</p>  Allowed values: `none`, `question`  |
| ```quiz[quiz_settings][allow_backtracking]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Whether to allow user to return to previous questions when ‘one_at_a_time_type’ is set to ‘question’.</p>  |
| ```quiz[quiz_settings][results_view_settings][result_view_restricted]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Whether the results view is restricted for students.  Must be true for any student restrictions to be set</p>  |
| ```quiz[quiz_settings][results_view_settings][display_points_awarded]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Whether points are shown. Must set result_view_restricted to true to use this parameter.</p>  |
| ```quiz[quiz_settings][results_view_settings][display_points_possible]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Whether points possible is shown. Must set result_view_restricted to true to use this parameter.</p>  |
| ```quiz[quiz_settings][results_view_settings][display_items]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Whether to show items in the results view.  Must be true for any items restrictions to be set</p>  |
| ```quiz[quiz_settings][results_view_settings][display_item_response]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Whether item response is shown.  Only set if display_items is true.  Must be true for display_item_response_correctness to be set.</p>  |
| ```quiz[quiz_settings][results_view_settings][display_item_response_correctness]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Whether item correctness is shown.  Only set if display_item_response is true.  Must be true for display_item_correct_answer to be set.</p>  |
| ```quiz[quiz_settings][results_view_settings][display_item_correct_answer]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Whether correct answer is shown.  Only set if display_item_response_correctness is true</p>  |
| ```quiz[quiz_settings][results_view_settings][display_item_feedback]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Whether Item feedback is shown.  Only set if display_items is true</p>  |
| ```quiz[quiz_settings][shuffle_answers]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Whether answers should be shuffled for students.</p>  |
| ```quiz[quiz_settings][shuffle_questions]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Whether questions should be shuffled for students.</p>  |
| ```quiz[quiz_settings][require_student_access_code]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Whether an access code is needed to take the quiz.</p>  |
| ```quiz[quiz_settings][student_access_code]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Access code to restrict quiz access. Should be null if no restriction.</p>  |
| ```quiz[quiz_settings][has_time_limit]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Whether there is a time limit for the quiz.</p>  |
| ```quiz[quiz_settings][session_time_limit_in_seconds]``` |  ```Positive Integer``` |  <p>Limit the time a student can work on the quiz. Should be null if no restriction.</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl 'https://<canvas>/api/quiz/v1/courses/1/quizzes' \
     -X POST \
     -H 'Authorization Bearer <token>' \
     -d 'quiz[title]=New quiz' \
     -d 'quiz[assignment_group_id]=1' \
     -d 'quiz[points_possible]=100.0' \
     -d 'quiz[due_at]=2023-01-02T00:00:00Z' \
     -d 'quiz[lock_at]=2023-01-03T00:00:00Z' \
     -d 'quiz[unlock_at]=2023-01-01T00:00:00Z' \
     -d 'quiz[grading_type]=points' \
     -d 'quiz[instructions]=Instructions for quiz' \
     -d 'quiz[quiz_settings][calculator_type]=scientific' \
     -d 'quiz[quiz_settings][filter_ip_address]=true' \
     -d 'quiz[quiz_settings][filters][ips]=[["10.0.0.0","10.10.0.0"], ["12.0.0.0", "12.10.10.0"]]' \
     -d 'quiz[quiz_settings][one_at_a_time_type]=question' \
     -d 'quiz[quiz_settings][allow_backtracking]=true' \
     -d 'quiz[quiz_settings][shuffle_answers]=true' \
     -d 'quiz[quiz_settings][shuffle_questions]=true' \
     -d 'quiz[quiz_settings][require_student_access_code]=true' \
     -d 'quiz[quiz_settings][student_access_code]=12345' \
     -d 'quiz[quiz_settings][has_time_limit]=true' \
     -d 'quiz[quiz_settings][session_time_limit_in_seconds]=7500' \
     -d 'quiz[quiz_settings][multiple_attempts][max_attempts]=4' \
     -d 'quiz[quiz_settings][multiple_attempts][attempt_limit]=true' \
     -d 'quiz[quiz_settings][multiple_attempts][score_to_keep]=average' \
     -d 'quiz[quiz_settings][multiple_attempts][cooling_period]=true' \
     -d 'quiz[quiz_settings][multiple_attempts][cooling_period_seconds]=93600' \
     -d 'quiz[quiz_settings][multiple_attempts][multiple_attempts_enabled]=true' \
     -d 'quiz[quiz_settings][result_view_settings][display_items]=true' \
     -d 'quiz[quiz_settings][result_view_settings][display_item_feedback]=true' \
     -d 'quiz[quiz_settings][result_view_settings][display_item_response]=true' \
     -d 'quiz[quiz_settings][result_view_settings][display_points_awarded]=true' \
     -d 'quiz[quiz_settings][result_view_settings][result_view_restricted]=true' \
     -d 'quiz[quiz_settings][result_view_settings][display_points_possible]=true' \
     -d 'quiz[quiz_settings][result_view_settings][display_item_correct_answer]=true' \
     -d 'quiz[quiz_settings][result_view_settings][display_item_response_correctness]=true'
```
    


Returns a
 [NewQuiz](new_quizzes.md#newquiz) object.

  ## [Create an Originality Report](#method.lti/originality_reports_api.create)<a name='method.lti/originality_reports_api.create'></a>


[Lti::OriginalityReportsApiController#create](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/lti/originality_reports_api_controller.rb)







  
#### `POST /api/lti/assignments/:assignment_id/submissions/:submission_id/originality_report`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/lti/assignments/:assignment_id/submissions/:submission_id/originality_report`


<p>Create a new OriginalityReport for the specified file</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```originality_report[file_id]``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>The id of the file being given an originality score. Required if creating a report associated with a file.</p>  |
| ```originality_report[originality_score]``` | Required ```number``` |  <p>A number between 0 and 100 representing the measure of the specified file’s originality.</p>  |
| ```originality_report[originality_report_url]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The URL where the originality report for the specified file may be found.</p>  |
| ```originality_report[originality_report_file_id]``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>The ID of the file within Canvas that contains the originality report for the submitted file provided in the request URL.</p>  |
| ```originality_report[tool_setting][resource_type_code]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The resource type code of the resource handler Canvas should use for the LTI launch for viewing originality reports. If set Canvas will launch to the message with type ‘basic-lti-launch-request’ in the specified resource handler rather than using the originality_report_url.</p>  |
| ```originality_report[tool_setting][resource_url]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The URL Canvas should launch to when showing an LTI originality report. Note that this value is inferred from the specified resource handler’s message “path” value (See ‘resource_type_code`) unless it is specified. If this parameter is used a `resource_type_code` must also be specified.</p>  |
| ```originality_report[workflow_state]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>May be set to “pending”, “error”, or “scored”. If an originality score is provided a workflow state of “scored” will be inferred.</p>  |
| ```originality_report[error_message]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>A message describing the error. If set, the “workflow_state” will be set to “error.”</p>  |
| ```originality_report[attempt]``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>If no ‘file_id` is given, and no file is required for the assignment (that is, the assignment allows an online text entry), this parameter may be given to clarify which attempt number the report is for (in the case of resubmissions). If this field is omitted and no `file_id` is given, the report will be created (or updated, if it exists) for the first submission attempt with no associated file.</p>  |



Returns an
 [OriginalityReport](originality_reports.md#originalityreport) object.

| ```originality_report[tool_setting][resource_url]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The URL Canvas should launch to when showing an LTI originality report. Note that this value is inferred from the specified resource handler’s message “path” value (See ‘resource_type_code`) unless it is specified. If this parameter is used a `resource_type_code` must also be specified.</p>  |
| ```originality_report[workflow_state]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>May be set to “pending”, “error”, or “scored”. If an originality score is provided a workflow state of “scored” will be inferred.</p>  |
| ```originality_report[error_message]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>A message describing the error. If set, the “workflow_state” will be set to “error.”</p>  |



Returns an
 [OriginalityReport](originality_reports.md#originalityreport) object.

#### `PUT /api/v1/global/outcome_groups/:id`
**Scope:** `url:PUT|/api/v1/global/outcome_groups/:id`

  
#### `PUT /api/v1/accounts/:account_id/outcome_groups/:id`

#### `PUT /api/v1/courses/:course_id/outcome_groups/:id`
**Scope:** `url:PUT|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/outcome_groups/:id`


<p>Modify an existing outcome group. Fields not provided are left as is; unrecognized fields are ignored.</p>

<p>When changing the parent outcome group, the new parent group must belong to the same context as this outcome group, and must not be a descendant of this outcome group (i.e. no cycles allowed).</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```title``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The new outcome group title.</p>  |
| ```description``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The new outcome group description.</p>  |
| ```vendor_guid``` |  ```string``` |  <p>A custom GUID for the learning standard.</p>  |
| ```parent_outcome_group_id``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>The id of the new parent outcome group.</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/accounts/1/outcome_groups/2.json' \
     -X PUT \
     -F 'title=Outcome Group Title' \
     -F 'description=Outcome group description' \
     -F 'vendor_guid=customid9000' \
     -F 'parent_outcome_group_id=1' \
     -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>"
```
    

```bash
curl 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/accounts/1/outcome_groups/2.json' \
     -X PUT \
     --data-binary '{
           "title": "Outcome Group Title",
           "description": "Outcome group description",
           "vendor_guid": "customid9000",
           "parent_outcome_group_id": 1
         }' \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>"
```
    


Returns an
 [OutcomeGroup](outcome_groups.md#outcomegroup) object.

  ## [Create/link an outcome](#method.outcome_groups_api.link)<a name='method.outcome_groups_api.link'></a>


[OutcomeGroupsApiController#link](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/outcome_groups_api_controller.rb)







  
#### `POST /api/v1/global/outcome_groups/:id/outcomes`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/global/outcome_groups/:id/outcomes`

  
#### `PUT /api/v1/global/outcome_groups/:id/outcomes/:outcome_id`
**Scope:** `url:PUT|/api/v1/global/outcome_groups/:id/outcomes/:outcome_id`

  
#### `POST /api/v1/accounts/:account_id/outcome_groups/:id/outcomes`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/accounts/:account_id/outcome_groups/:id/outcomes`

  
#### `PUT /api/v1/accounts/:account_id/outcome_groups/:id/outcomes/:outcome_id`
**Scope:** `url:PUT|/api/v1/accounts/:account_id/outcome_groups/:id/outcomes/:outcome_id`

  
#### `POST /api/v1/courses/:course_id/outcome_groups/:id/outcomes`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/outcome_groups/:id/outcomes`

  
#### `PUT /api/v1/courses/:course_id/outcome_groups/:id/outcomes/:outcome_id`
**Scope:** `url:PUT|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/outcome_groups/:id/outcomes/:outcome_id`


<p>Link an outcome into the outcome group. The outcome to link can either be specified by a PUT to the link URL for a specific outcome (the outcome_id in the PUT URLs) or by supplying the information for a new outcome (title, description, ratings, mastery_points) in a POST to the collection.</p>

<p>If linking an existing outcome, the outcome_id must identify an outcome available to this context; i.e. an outcome owned by this group’s context, an outcome owned by an associated account, or a global outcome. With outcome_id present, any other parameters (except move_from) are ignored.</p>

<p>If defining a new outcome, the outcome is created in the outcome group’s context using the provided title, description, ratings, and mastery points; the title is required but all other fields are optional. The new outcome is then linked into the outcome group.</p>

<p>If ratings are provided when creating a new outcome, an embedded rubric criterion is included in the new outcome. This criterion’s mastery_points default to the maximum points in the highest rating if not specified in the mastery_points parameter. Any ratings lacking a description are given a default of “No description”. Any ratings lacking a point value are given a default of 0. If no ratings are provided, the mastery_points parameter is ignored.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```outcome_id``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>The ID of the existing outcome to link.</p>  |
| ```move_from``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>The ID of the old outcome group. Only used if outcome_id is present.</p>  |
| ```title``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The title of the new outcome. Required if outcome_id is absent.</p>  |
| ```display_name``` |  ```string``` |  <p>A friendly name shown in reports for outcomes with cryptic titles, such as common core standards names.</p>  |
| ```description``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The description of the new outcome.</p>  |
| ```vendor_guid``` |  ```string``` |  <p>A custom GUID for the learning standard.</p>  |
| ```mastery_points``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>The mastery threshold for the embedded rubric criterion.</p>  |
| ```ratings[][description]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The description of a rating level for the embedded rubric criterion.</p>  |
| ```ratings[][points]``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>The points corresponding to a rating level for the embedded rubric criterion.</p>  |
| ```calculation_method``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The new calculation method.  Defaults to “decaying_average” if the Outcomes New Decaying Average Calculation Method FF is ENABLED then Defaults to “weighted_average”</p>  Allowed values: `weighted_average`, `decaying_average`, `n_mastery`, `latest`, `highest`, `average`  |
| ```calculation_int``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>The new calculation int.  Only applies if the calculation_method is “weighted_average”, “decaying_average” or “n_mastery”. Defaults to 65</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/accounts/1/outcome_groups/1/outcomes/1.json' \
     -X PUT \
     -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>"
```
    

```bash
curl 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/accounts/1/outcome_groups/1/outcomes.json' \
     -X POST \
     -F 'title=Outcome Title' \
     -F 'display_name=Title for reporting' \
     -F 'description=Outcome description' \
     -F 'vendor_guid=customid9000' \
     -F 'mastery_points=3' \
     -F 'calculation_method=decaying_average' \
     -F 'calculation_int=65' \
     -F 'ratings[][description]=Exceeds Expectations' \
     -F 'ratings[][points]=5' \
     -F 'ratings[][description]=Meets Expectations' \
     -F 'ratings[][points]=3' \
     -F 'ratings[][description]=Does Not Meet Expectations' \
     -F 'ratings[][points]=0' \
     -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>"
```
    

```bash
curl 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/accounts/1/outcome_groups/1/outcomes.json' \
     -X POST \
     --data-binary '{
           "title": "Outcome Title",
           "display_name": "Title for reporting",
           "description": "Outcome description",
           "vendor_guid": "customid9000",
           "mastery_points": 3,
           "ratings": [
             { "description": "Exceeds Expectations", "points": 5 },
             { "description": "Meets Expectations", "points": 3 },
             { "description": "Does Not Meet Expectations", "points": 0 }
           ]
         }' \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>"
```
    


Returns an
 [OutcomeLink](outcome_groups.md#outcomelink) object.

  ## [Import an outcome group](#method.outcome_groups_api.import)<a name='method.outcome_groups_api.import'></a>


[OutcomeGroupsApiController#import](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/outcome_groups_api_controller.rb)







  
#### `POST /api/v1/global/outcome_groups/:id/import`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/global/outcome_groups/:id/import`

  
#### `POST /api/v1/accounts/:account_id/outcome_groups/:id/import`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/accounts/:account_id/outcome_groups/:id/import`

  
#### `POST /api/v1/courses/:course_id/outcome_groups/:id/import`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/outcome_groups/:id/import`


<p>Creates a new subgroup of the outcome group with the same title and description as the source group, then creates links in that new subgroup to the same outcomes that are linked in the source group. Recurses on the subgroups of the source group, importing them each in turn into the new subgroup.</p>

<p>Allows you to copy organizational structure, but does not create copies of the outcomes themselves, only new links.</p>

<p>The source group must be either global, from the same context as this outcome group, or from an associated account. The source group cannot be the root outcome group of its context.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```source_outcome_group_id``` | Required ```integer``` |  <p>The ID of the source outcome group.</p>  |
| ```async``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>If true, perform action asynchronously.  In that case, this endpoint will return a Progress object instead of an OutcomeGroup. Use the <a href="progress.md#method.progress.show" title="progress endpoint">progress endpoint</a> to query the status of the operation.  The imported outcome group id and url will be returned in the results of the Progress object as “outcome_group_id” and “outcome_group_url”</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/accounts/2/outcome_groups/3/import.json' \
     -X POST \
     -F 'source_outcome_group_id=2' \
     -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>"
```
    


Returns an
 [OutcomeGroup](outcome_groups.md#outcomegroup) object.



  ## [Import Outcomes](#method.outcome_imports_api.create)<a name='method.outcome_imports_api.create'></a>


[OutcomeImportsApiController#create](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/outcome_imports_api_controller.rb)







  
#### `POST /api/v1/accounts/:account_id/outcome_imports(/group/:learning_outcome_group_id)`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/accounts/:account_id/outcome_imports(/group/:learning_outcome_group_id)`

  
#### `POST /api/v1/courses/:course_id/outcome_imports(/group/:learning_outcome_group_id)`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/outcome_imports(/group/:learning_outcome_group_id)`


<p>Import outcomes into Canvas.</p>

<p>For more information on the format that’s expected here, please see the “Outcomes CSV” section in the API docs.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```import_type``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Choose the data format for reading outcome data. With a standard Canvas install, this option can only be ‘instructure_csv’, and if unprovided, will be assumed to be so. Can be part of the query string.</p>  |
| ```attachment``` |  ```string``` |  <p>There are two ways to post outcome import data - either via a multipart/form-data form-field-style attachment, or via a non-multipart raw post request.</p><br><p>‘attachment’ is required for multipart/form-data style posts. Assumed to be outcome data from a file upload form field named ‘attachment’.</p><br><p>Examples:</p><br><pre class="code ruby"><code class="ruby">curl -F attachment=@&lt;filename&gt; -H &quot;Authorization: Bearer &lt;token&gt;&quot; \<br>    &#39;https://&lt;canvas&gt;/api/v1/accounts/&lt;account_id&gt;/outcome_imports?import_type=instructure_csv&#39;<br>curl -F attachment=@&lt;filename&gt; -H &quot;Authorization: Bearer &lt;token&gt;&quot; \<br>    &#39;https://&lt;canvas&gt;/api/v1/courses/&lt;course_id&gt;/outcome_imports?import_type=instructure_csv&#39;<br></code></pre><br><p>If you decide to do a raw post, you can skip the ‘attachment’ argument, but you will then be required to provide a suitable Content-Type header. You are encouraged to also provide the ‘extension’ argument.</p><br><p>Examples:</p><br><pre class="code ruby"><code class="ruby">curl -H &#39;Content-Type: text/csv&#39; --data-binary @&lt;filename&gt;.csv \<br>    -H &quot;Authorization: Bearer &lt;token&gt;&quot; \<br>    &#39;https://&lt;canvas&gt;/api/v1/accounts/&lt;account_id&gt;/outcome_imports?import_type=instructure_csv&#39;<br>curl -H &#39;Content-Type: text/csv&#39; --data-binary @&lt;filename&gt;.csv \<br>    -H &quot;Authorization: Bearer &lt;token&gt;&quot; \<br>    &#39;https://&lt;canvas&gt;/api/v1/courses/&lt;course_id&gt;/outcome_imports?import_type=instructure_csv&#39;<br></code></pre>  |
| ```extension``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Recommended for raw post request style imports. This field will be used to distinguish between csv and other file format extensions that would usually be provided with the filename in the multipart post request scenario. If not provided, this value will be inferred from the Content-Type, falling back to csv-file format if all else fails.</p>  |



Returns an
 [OutcomeImport](outcome_imports.md#outcomeimport) object.

  ## [Get outcome results](#method.outcome_results.index)<a name='method.outcome_results.index'></a>


[OutcomeResultsController#index](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/outcome_results_controller.rb)







  
#### `GET /api/v1/courses/:course_id/outcome_results`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/outcome_results`


<p>Gets the outcome results for users and outcomes in the specified context.</p>

<p>used in sLMGB</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```user_ids[]``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>If specified, only the users whose ids are given will be included in the results. SIS ids can be used, prefixed by “sis_user_id:”. It is an error to specify an id for a user who is not a student in the context.</p>  |
| ```outcome_ids[]``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>If specified, only the outcomes whose ids are given will be included in the results. it is an error to specify an id for an outcome which is not linked to the context.</p>  |
| ```include[]``` |  ```string``` |  <br>- String, “alignments”|“outcomes”|“outcomes.alignments”|“outcome_groups”|“outcome_links”|“outcome_paths”|“users”<br><br>  Specify additional collections to be side loaded with the result. “alignments” includes only the alignments referenced by the returned results. “outcomes.alignments” includes all alignments referenced by outcomes in the context.<br><br>  |
| ```include_hidden``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>If true, results that are hidden from the learning mastery gradebook and student rollup scores will be included</p>  |



#### Example Response:
    

```js
{
  outcome_results: [OutcomeResult]
}
```

  ## [Get outcome result rollups](#method.outcome_results.rollups)<a name='method.outcome_results.rollups'></a>


[OutcomeResultsController#rollups](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/outcome_results_controller.rb)







  
#### `GET /api/v1/courses/:course_id/outcome_rollups`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/courses/:course_id/outcome_rollups`


<p>Gets the outcome rollups for the users and outcomes in the specified context.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```aggregate``` |  ```string``` |  <p>If specified, instead of returning one rollup for each user, all the user rollups will be combined into one rollup for the course that will contain the average (or median, see below) rollup score for each outcome.</p>  Allowed values: `course`  |
| ```aggregate_stat``` |  ```string``` |  <p>If aggregate rollups requested, then this value determines what statistic is used for the aggregate. Defaults to “mean” if this value is not specified.</p>  Allowed values: `mean`, `median`  |
| ```user_ids[]``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>If specified, only the users whose ids are given will be included in the results or used in an aggregate result. it is an error to specify an id for a user who is not a student in the context</p>  |
| ```outcome_ids[]``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>If specified, only the outcomes whose ids are given will be included in the results. it is an error to specify an id for an outcome which is not linked to the context.</p>  |
| ```include[]``` |  ```string``` |  <br>- String, “courses”|“outcomes”|“outcomes.alignments”|“outcome_groups”|“outcome_links”|“outcome_paths”|“users”<br><br>  Specify additional collections to be side loaded with the result.<br><br>  |
| ```exclude[]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Specify additional values to exclude. “missing_user_rollups” excludes rollups for users without results.</p>  Allowed values: `missing_user_rollups`  |
| ```sort_by``` |  ```string``` |  <p>If specified, sorts outcome result rollups. “student” sorting will sort by a user’s sortable name. “outcome” sorting will sort by the given outcome’s rollup score. The latter requires specifying the “sort_outcome_id” parameter. By default, the sort order is ascending.</p>  Allowed values: `student`, `outcome`  |
| ```sort_outcome_id``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>If outcome sorting requested, then this determines which outcome to use for rollup score sorting.</p>  |
| ```sort_order``` |  ```string``` |  <p>If sorting requested, then this allows changing the default sort order of ascending to descending.</p>  Allowed values: `asc`, `desc`  |
| ```add_defaults``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>If defaults are requested, then color and mastery level defaults will be added to outcome ratings in the rollup. This will only take effect if the Account Level Mastery Scales FF is DISABLED</p>  |
| ```contributing_scores``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>If contributing scores are requested, then each individual outcome score will also include all graded artifacts that contributed to the outcome score</p>  |



#### Example Response:
    

```js
{
  "rollups": [OutcomeRollup],
  "linked": {
    // (Optional) Included if include[] has outcomes
    "outcomes": [Outcome],

    // (Optional) Included if aggregate is not set and include[] has users
    "users": [User],

    // (Optional) Included if aggregate is 'course' and include[] has courses
    "courses": [Course]

    // (Optional) Included if include[] has outcome_groups
    "outcome_groups": [OutcomeGroup],

    // (Optional) Included if include[] has outcome_links
    "outcome_links": [OutcomeLink]

    // (Optional) Included if include[] has outcome_paths
    "outcome_paths": [OutcomePath]

    // (Optional) Included if include[] has outcomes.alignments
    "outcomes.alignments": [OutcomeAlignment]
  }
}
```
