  ## [Add an observee with credentials](#method.user_observees.create)<a name='method.user_observees.create'></a>


[UserObserveesController#create](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/user_observees_controller.rb)







  
#### `POST /api/v1/users/:user_id/observees`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/users/:user_id/observees`


<p>Register the given user to observe another user, given the observee’s credentials.</p>

<p><strong>Note:</strong> all users are allowed to add their own observees, given the observee’s credentials or access token are provided. Administrators can add observees given credentials, access token or the <a href="user_observees.md#method.user_observees.update" title="observee’s id">observee’s id</a>.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```observee[unique_id]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The login id for the user to observe.  Required if access_token is omitted.</p>  |
| ```observee[password]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The password for the user to observe. Required if access_token is omitted.</p>  |
| ```access_token``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The access token for the user to observe.  Required if <code>observee[unique_id]</code> or <code>observee[password]</code> are omitted.</p>  |
| ```pairing_code``` |  ```string``` |  <p>A generated pairing code for the user to observe. Required if the Observer pairing code feature flag is enabled</p>  |
| ```root_account_id``` |  ```integer``` |  <p>The ID for the root account to associate with the observation link. Defaults to the current domain account. If ‘all’ is specified, a link will be created for each root account associated to both the observer and observee.</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl https://<canvas>/api/v1/users/<user_id>/observees \
     -X POST \
     -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>' \
     -F 'observee[unique_id]=UNIQUE_ID' \
     -F 'observee[password]=PASSWORD'
```
    


Returns an
 [User](users.md#user) object.

  ## [List users in account](#method.users.api_index)<a name='method.users.api_index'></a>

#### `GET /api/v1/accounts/:account_id/users`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/accounts/:account_id/users`


<p>A paginated list of users associated with this account.</p>

<pre class="code ruby"><code class="ruby">@example_request
  curl https://&lt;canvas&gt;/api/v1/accounts/self/users?search_term=&lt;search value&gt; \
     -X GET \
     -H &#39;Authorization: Bearer &lt;token&gt;&#39;
</code></pre>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```search_term``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The partial name or full ID of the users to match and return in the results list. Must be at least 3 characters.</p><br><p>Note that the API will prefer matching on canonical user ID if the ID has a numeric form. It will only search against other fields if non-numeric in form, or if the numeric value doesn’t yield any matches. Queries by administrative users will search on SIS ID, Integration ID, login ID, name, or email address</p>  |
| ```enrollment_type``` |  ```string``` |  <p>When set, only return users enrolled with the specified course-level base role. This can be a base role type of ‘student’, ‘teacher’, ‘ta’, ‘observer’, or ‘designer’.</p>  |
| ```sort``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The column to sort results by.</p>  Allowed values: `username`, `email`, `sis_id`, `integration_id`, `last_login`  |
| ```order``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The order to sort the given column by.</p>  Allowed values: `asc`, `desc`  |
| ```include_deleted_users``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>When set to true and used with an account context, returns users who have deleted pseudonyms for the context</p>  |



Returns a list of
 [User](users.md#user) objects.



  ## [List the activity stream](#method.users.activity_stream)<a name='method.users.activity_stream'></a>


[UsersController#activity_stream](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/users_controller.rb)







  
#### `GET /api/v1/users/self/activity_stream`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/users/self/activity_stream`

  
#### `GET /api/v1/users/activity_stream`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/users/activity_stream`


<p>Returns the current user’s global activity stream, paginated.</p>

<p>There are many types of objects that can be returned in the activity stream. All object types have the same basic set of shared attributes:</p>

<pre class="code javascript"><code class="javascript">{
  &#39;created_at&#39;: &#39;2011-07-13T09:12:00Z&#39;,
  &#39;updated_at&#39;: &#39;2011-07-25T08:52:41Z&#39;,
  &#39;id&#39;: 1234,
  &#39;title&#39;: &#39;Stream Item Subject&#39;,
  &#39;message&#39;: &#39;This is the body text of the activity stream item. It is plain-text, and can be multiple paragraphs.&#39;,
  &#39;type&#39;: &#39;DiscussionTopic|Conversation|Message|Submission|Conference|Collaboration|AssessmentRequest...&#39;,
  &#39;read_state&#39;: false,
  &#39;context_type&#39;: &#39;course&#39;, // course|group
  &#39;course_id&#39;: 1,
  &#39;group_id&#39;: null,
  &#39;html_url&#39;: &quot;http://...&quot; // URL to the Canvas web UI for this stream item
}
</code></pre>

<p>In addition, each item type has its own set of attributes available.</p>

<p>DiscussionTopic:</p>

<pre class="code javascript"><code class="javascript">{
  &#39;type&#39;: &#39;DiscussionTopic&#39;,
  &#39;discussion_topic_id&#39;: 1234,
  &#39;total_root_discussion_entries&#39;: 5,
  &#39;require_initial_post&#39;: true,
  &#39;user_has_posted&#39;: true,
  &#39;root_discussion_entries&#39;: {
    ...
  }
}
</code></pre>

<p>For DiscussionTopic, the message is truncated at 4kb.</p>

<p>Announcement:</p>

<pre class="code javascript"><code class="javascript">{
  &#39;type&#39;: &#39;Announcement&#39;,
  &#39;announcement_id&#39;: 1234,
  &#39;total_root_discussion_entries&#39;: 5,
  &#39;require_initial_post&#39;: true,
  &#39;user_has_posted&#39;: null,
  &#39;root_discussion_entries&#39;: {
    ...
  }
}
</code></pre>

<p>For Announcement, the message is truncated at 4kb.</p>

<p>Conversation:</p>

<pre class="code javascript"><code class="javascript">{
  &#39;type&#39;: &#39;Conversation&#39;,
  &#39;conversation_id&#39;: 1234,
  &#39;private&#39;: false,
  &#39;participant_count&#39;: 3,
}
</code></pre>

<p>Message:</p>

<pre class="code javascript"><code class="javascript">{
  &#39;type&#39;: &#39;Message&#39;,
  &#39;message_id&#39;: 1234,
  &#39;notification_category&#39;: &#39;Assignment Graded&#39;
}
</code></pre>

<p>Submission:</p>

<p>Returns an <a href="submissions.md#Submission" title="Submission">Submission</a> with its Course and Assignment data.</p>

<p>Conference:</p>

<pre class="code javascript"><code class="javascript">{
  &#39;type&#39;: &#39;Conference&#39;,
  &#39;web_conference_id&#39;: 1234
}
</code></pre>

<p>Collaboration:</p>

<pre class="code javascript"><code class="javascript">{
  &#39;type&#39;: &#39;Collaboration&#39;,
  &#39;collaboration_id&#39;: 1234
}
</code></pre>

<p>AssessmentRequest:</p>

<pre class="code javascript"><code class="javascript">{
  &#39;type&#39;: &#39;AssessmentRequest&#39;,
  &#39;assessment_request_id&#39;: 1234
}
</code></pre>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```only_active_courses``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>If true, will only return objects for courses the user is actively participating in</p>  |

  ## [List the TODO items](#method.users.todo_items)<a name='method.users.todo_items'></a>


[UsersController#todo_items](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/users_controller.rb)







  
#### `GET /api/v1/users/self/todo`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/users/self/todo`


<p>A paginated list of the current user’s list of todo items.</p>

<p>There is a limit to the number of items returned.</p>

<p>The ‘ignore` and `ignore_permanently` URLs can be used to update the user’s preferences on what items will be displayed. Performing a DELETE request against the ‘ignore` URL will hide that item from future todo item requests, until the item changes. Performing a DELETE request against the `ignore_permanently` URL will hide that item forever.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```include[]``` |  ```string``` |  <br>- “ungraded_quizzes”<br><br>  Optionally include ungraded quizzes (such as practice quizzes and surveys) in the list. These will be returned under a quiz key instead of an assignment key in response elements.<br><br>  Allowed values: `ungraded_quizzes`  |



#### Example Response:
    

```js
[
  {
    'type': 'grading',        // an assignment that needs grading
    'assignment': { .. assignment object .. },
    'ignore': '.. url ..',
    'ignore_permanently': '.. url ..',
    'html_url': '.. url ..',
    'needs_grading_count': 3, // number of submissions that need grading
    'context_type': 'course', // course|group
    'course_id': 1,
    'group_id': null,
  },
  {
    'type' => 'submitting',   // an assignment that needs submitting soon
    'assignment' => { .. assignment object .. },
    'ignore' => '.. url ..',
    'ignore_permanently' => '.. url ..',
    'html_url': '.. url ..',
    'context_type': 'course',
    'course_id': 1,
  },
  {
    'type' => 'submitting',   // a quiz that needs submitting soon
    'quiz' => { .. quiz object .. },
    'ignore' => '.. url ..',
    'ignore_permanently' => '.. url ..',
    'html_url': '.. url ..',
    'context_type': 'course',
    'course_id': 1,
  },
]
```
    



  ## [List counts for todo items](#method.users.todo_item_count)<a name='method.users.todo_item_count'></a>


[UsersController#todo_item_count](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/users_controller.rb)







  
#### `GET /api/v1/users/self/todo_item_count`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/users/self/todo_item_count`


<p>Counts of different todo items such as the number of assignments needing grading as well as the number of assignments needing submitting.</p>

<p>There is a limit to the number of todo items this endpoint will count. It will only look at the first 100 todo items for the user. If the user has more than 100 todo items this count may not be reliable. The largest reliable number for both counts is 100.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```include[]``` |  ```string``` |  <br>- “ungraded_quizzes”<br><br>  Optionally include ungraded quizzes (such as practice quizzes and surveys) in the list. These will be returned under a quiz key instead of an assignment key in response elements.<br><br>  Allowed values: `ungraded_quizzes`  |



#### Example Response:
    

```js
{
  needs_grading_count: 32,
  assignments_needing_submitting: 10
}
```

  ## [List Missing Submissions](#method.users.missing_submissions)<a name='method.users.missing_submissions'></a>


[UsersController#missing_submissions](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/users_controller.rb)







  
#### `GET /api/v1/users/:user_id/missing_submissions`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/users/:user_id/missing_submissions`


<p>A paginated list of past-due assignments for which the student does not have a submission. The user sending the request must either be the student, an admin or a parent observer using the parent app</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```user_id``` |  ```string``` |  <p>the student’s ID</p>  |
| ```observed_user_id``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Return missing submissions for the given observed user. Must be accompanied by course_ids[]. The user making the request must be observing the observed user in all the courses specified by course_ids[].</p>  |
| ```include[]``` |  ```string``` |  <br>- “planner_overrides”<br><br>  Optionally include the assignment’s associated planner override, if it exists, for the current user. These will be returned under a planner_override key<br><br><br>- “course”<br><br>  Optionally include the assignments’ courses<br><br>  Allowed values: `planner_overrides`, `course`  |
| ```filter[]``` |  ```string``` |  <br>- “submittable”<br><br>  Only return assignments that the current user can submit (i.e. filter out locked assignments)<br><br><br>- “current_grading_period”<br><br>  Only return missing assignments that are in the current grading period<br><br>  Allowed values: `submittable`, `current_grading_period`  |
| ```course_ids[]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Optionally restricts the list of past-due assignments to only those associated with the specified course IDs. Required if observed_user_id is passed.</p>  |



Returns a list of
 [Assignment](assignments.md#assignment) objects.

  ## [Create a user](#method.users.create)<a name='method.users.create'></a>


[UsersController#create](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/users_controller.rb)







  
#### `POST /api/v1/accounts/:account_id/users`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/accounts/:account_id/users`


<p>Create and return a new user and pseudonym for an account.</p>
<br>- DEPRECATED (for self-registration only)<br><br>  If you don’t have the “Modify<br><br>

<p>login details for users“ permission, but self-registration is enabled on the account, you can still use this endpoint to register new users. Certain fields will be required, and others will be ignored (see below).</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```user[name]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The full name of the user. This name will be used by teacher for grading. Required if this is a self-registration.</p>  |
| ```user[short_name]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>User’s name as it will be displayed in discussions, messages, and comments.</p>  |
| ```user[sortable_name]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>User’s name as used to sort alphabetically in lists.</p>  |
| ```user[time_zone]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The time zone for the user. Allowed time zones are <a href="http://www.iana.org/time-zones" target="_parent" title="IANA time zones">IANA time zones</a> or friendlier <a href="http://api.rubyonrails.org/classes/ActiveSupport/TimeZone.html" target="_parent" title="Ruby on Rails time zones">Ruby on Rails time zones</a>.</p>  |
| ```user[locale]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The user’s preferred language, from the list of languages Canvas supports. This is in RFC-5646 format.</p>  |
| ```user[terms_of_use]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Whether the user accepts the terms of use. Required if this is a self-registration and this canvas instance requires users to accept the terms (on by default).</p><br><p>If this is true, it will mark the user as having accepted the terms of use.</p>  |
| ```user[skip_registration]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Automatically mark the user as registered.</p><br><p>If this is true, it is recommended to set <code>&quot;pseudonym[send_confirmation]&quot;</code> to true as well. Otherwise, the user will not receive any messages about their account creation.</p><br><p>The users communication channel confirmation can be skipped by setting <code>&quot;communication_channel[skip_confirmation]&quot;</code> to true as well.</p>  |
| ```pseudonym[unique_id]``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>User’s login ID. If this is a self-registration, it must be a valid email address.</p>  |
| ```pseudonym[password]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>User’s password. Cannot be set during self-registration.</p>  |
| ```pseudonym[sis_user_id]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>SIS ID for the user’s account. To set this parameter, the caller must be able to manage SIS permissions.</p>  |
| ```pseudonym[integration_id]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Integration ID for the login. To set this parameter, the caller must be able to manage SIS permissions. The Integration ID is a secondary identifier useful for more complex SIS integrations.</p>  |
| ```pseudonym[send_confirmation]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Send user notification of account creation if true. Automatically set to true during self-registration.</p>  |
| ```pseudonym[force_self_registration]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Send user a self-registration style email if true. Setting it means the users will get a notification asking them to “complete the registration process” by clicking it, setting a password, and letting them in.  Will only be executed on if the user does not need admin approval. Defaults to false unless explicitly provided.</p>  |
| ```pseudonym[authentication_provider_id]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The authentication provider this login is associated with. Logins associated with a specific provider can only be used with that provider. Legacy providers (LDAP, CAS, SAML) will search for logins associated with them, or unassociated logins. New providers will only search for logins explicitly associated with them. This can be the integer ID of the provider, or the type of the provider (in which case, it will find the first matching provider).</p>  |
| ```communication_channel[type]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The communication channel type, e.g. ‘email’ or ‘sms’.</p>  |
| ```communication_channel[address]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The communication channel address, e.g. the user’s email address.</p>  |
| ```communication_channel[confirmation_url]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Only valid for account admins. If true, returns the new user account confirmation URL in the response.</p>  |
| ```communication_channel[skip_confirmation]``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Only valid for site admins and account admins making requests; If true, the channel is automatically validated and no confirmation email or SMS is sent. Otherwise, the user must respond to a confirmation message to confirm the channel.</p><br><p>If this is true, it is recommended to set <code>&quot;pseudonym[send_confirmation]&quot;</code> to true as well. Otherwise, the user will not receive any messages about their account creation.</p>  |
| ```force_validations``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>If true, validations are performed on the newly created user (and their associated pseudonym) even if the request is made by a privileged user like an admin. When set to false, or not included in the request parameters, any newly created users are subject to validations unless the request is made by a user with a ‘manage_user_logins’ right. In which case, certain validations such as ‘require_acceptance_of_terms’ and ‘require_presence_of_name’ are not enforced. Use this parameter to return helpful json errors while building users with an admin request.</p>  |
| ```enable_sis_reactivation``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>When true, will first try to re-activate a deleted user with matching sis_user_id if possible. This is commonly done with <a href="skip_registration">user</a> and <a href="skip_confirmation">communication_channel</a> so that the default communication_channel is also restored.</p>  |
| ```destination``` |  ```URL``` |  <p>If you’re setting the password for the newly created user, you can provide this param with a valid URL pointing into this Canvas installation, and the response will include a destination field that’s a URL that you can redirect a browser to and have the newly created user automatically logged in. The URL is only valid for a short time, and must match the domain this request is directed to, and be for a well-formed path that Canvas can recognize.</p>  |
| ```initial_enrollment_type``` |  ```string``` |  <p>‘observer` if doing a self-registration with a pairing code. This allows setting the password during user creation.</p>  |
| ```pairing_code[code]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>If provided and valid, will link the new user as an observer to the student’s whose pairing code is given.</p>  |



Returns an
 [User](users.md#user) object.

**Scope:** `url:PUT|/api/v1/users/:id/settings`

#### `PUT /api/v1/users/:id`
**Scope:** `url:PUT|/api/v1/users/:id`


<p>Modify an existing user. To modify a user’s login, see the documentation for logins.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```user[name]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The full name of the user. This name will be used by teacher for grading.</p>  |
| ```user[short_name]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>User’s name as it will be displayed in discussions, messages, and comments.</p>  |
| ```user[sortable_name]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>User’s name as used to sort alphabetically in lists.</p>  |
| ```user[time_zone]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The time zone for the user. Allowed time zones are <a href="http://www.iana.org/time-zones" target="_parent" title="IANA time zones">IANA time zones</a> or friendlier <a href="http://api.rubyonrails.org/classes/ActiveSupport/TimeZone.html" target="_parent" title="Ruby on Rails time zones">Ruby on Rails time zones</a>.</p>  |
| ```user[email]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The default email address of the user.</p>  |
| ```user[locale]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>The user’s preferred language, from the list of languages Canvas supports. This is in RFC-5646 format.</p>  |
| ```user[avatar][token]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>A unique representation of the avatar record to assign as the user’s current avatar. This token can be obtained from the user avatars endpoint. This supersedes the user [avatar] [url] argument, and if both are included the url will be ignored. Note: this is an internal representation and is subject to change without notice. It should be consumed with this api endpoint and used in the user update endpoint, and should not be constructed by the client.</p>  |
| ```user[avatar][url]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>To set the user’s avatar to point to an external url, do not include a token and instead pass the url here. Warning: For maximum compatibility, please use 128 px square images.</p>  |
| ```user[avatar][state]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>To set the state of user’s avatar. Only valid for account administrator.</p>  Allowed values: `none`, `submitted`, `approved`, `locked`, `reported`, `re_reported`  |
| ```user[title]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Sets a title on the user profile. (See <a href="users.md#method.profile.settings" title="Get user profile">Get user profile</a>.) Profiles must be enabled on the root account.</p>  |
| ```user[bio]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Sets a bio on the user profile. (See <a href="users.md#method.profile.settings" title="Get user profile">Get user profile</a>.) Profiles must be enabled on the root account.</p>  |
| ```user[pronunciation]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Sets name pronunciation on the user profile. (See <a href="users.md#method.profile.settings" title="Get user profile">Get user profile</a>.) Profiles and name pronunciation must be enabled on the root account.</p>  |
| ```user[pronouns]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Sets pronouns on the user profile. Passing an empty string will empty the user’s pronouns Only Available Pronouns set on the root account are allowed Adding and changing pronouns must be enabled on the root account.</p>  |
| ```user[event]``` |  ```string``` |  <p>Suspends or unsuspends all logins for this user that the calling user has permission to</p>  Allowed values: `suspend`, `unsuspend`  |
| ```override_sis_stickiness``` |  ```boolean``` |  <p>Default is true. If false, any fields containing “sticky” changes will not be updated. See SIS CSV Format documentation for information on which fields can have SIS stickiness</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/users/133' \
     -X PUT \
     -F 'user[name]=Sheldon Cooper' \
     -F 'user[short_name]=Shelly' \
     -F 'user[time_zone]=Pacific Time (US & Canada)' \
     -F 'user[avatar][token]=<opaque_token>' \
     -H "Authorization: Bearer <token>"
```
    


Returns an
 [User](users.md#user) object.

  ## [Merge user into another user](#method.users.merge_into)<a name='method.users.merge_into'></a>


[UsersController#merge_into](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/users_controller.rb)







  
#### `PUT /api/v1/users/:id/merge_into/:destination_user_id`
**Scope:** `url:PUT|/api/v1/users/:id/merge_into/:destination_user_id`

  
#### `PUT /api/v1/users/:id/merge_into/accounts/:destination_account_id/users/:destination_user_id`
**Scope:** `url:PUT|/api/v1/users/:id/merge_into/accounts/:destination_account_id/users/:destination_user_id`


<p>Merge a user into another user. To merge users, the caller must have permissions to manage both users. This should be considered irreversible. This will delete the user and move all the data into the destination user.</p>

<p>User merge details and caveats: The from_user is the user that was deleted in the user_merge process. The destination_user is the user that remains, that is being split.</p>

<p>Avatars: When both users have avatars, only the destination_users avatar will remain. When one user has an avatar, will it will end up on the destination_user.</p>

<p>Terms of Use: If either user has accepted terms of use, it will be be left as accepted.</p>

<p>Communication Channels: All unique communication channels moved to the destination_user. All notification preferences are moved to the destination_user.</p>

<p>Enrollments: All unique enrollments are moved to the destination_user. When there is an enrollment that would end up making it so that a user would be observing themselves, the enrollment is not moved over. Everything that is tied to the from_user at the course level relating to the enrollment is also moved to the destination_user.</p>

<p>Submissions: All submissions are moved to the destination_user. If there are enrollments for both users in the same course, we prefer submissions that have grades then submissions that have work in them, and if there are no grades or no work, they are not moved.</p>

<p>Other notes: Access Tokens are moved on merge. Conversations are moved on merge. Favorites are moved on merge. Courses will commonly use LTI tools. LTI tools reference the user with IDs that are stored on a user object. Merging users deletes one user and moves all records from the deleted user to the destination_user. These IDs are kept for all enrollments, group_membership, and account_users for the from_user at the time of the merge. When the destination_user launches an LTI tool from a course that used to be the from_user’s, it doesn’t appear as a new user to the tool provider. Instead it will send the stored ids. The destination_user’s LTI IDs remain as they were for the courses that they originally had. Future enrollments for the destination_user will use the IDs that are on the destination_user object. LTI IDs that are kept and tracked per context include lti_context_id, lti_id and uuid. APIs that return the LTI ids will return the one for the context that it is called for, except for the user uuid. The user UUID will display the destination_users uuid, and when getting the uuid from an api that is in a context that was recorded from a merge event, an additional attribute is added as past_uuid.</p>

<p>When finding users by SIS ids in different accounts the destination_account_id is required.</p>

<p>The account can also be identified by passing the domain in destination_account_id.</p>


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl https://<canvas>/api/v1/users/<user_id>/merge_into/<destination_user_id> \
     -X PUT \
     -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'
```
    

```bash
curl https://<canvas>/api/v1/users/<user_id>/merge_into/accounts/<destination_account_id>/users/<destination_user_id> \
     -X PUT \
     -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'
```
    


Returns an
 [User](users.md#user) object.



  ## [Split merged users into separate users](#method.users.split)<a name='method.users.split'></a>


[UsersController#split](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/users_controller.rb)







  
#### `POST /api/v1/users/:id/split`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/v1/users/:id/split`


<p>Merged users cannot be fully restored to their previous state, but this will attempt to split as much as possible to the previous state. To split a merged user, the caller must have permissions to manage all of the users logins. If there are multiple users that have been merged into one user it will split each merge into a separate user. A split can only happen within 180 days of a user merge. A user merge deletes the previous user and may be permanently deleted. In this scenario we create a new user object and proceed to move as much as possible to the new user. The user object will not have preserved the name or settings from the previous user. Some items may have been deleted during a user_merge that cannot be restored, and/or the data has become stale because of other changes to the objects since the time of the user_merge.</p>

<p>Split users details and caveats:</p>

<p>The from_user is the user that was deleted in the user_merge process. The destination_user is the user that remains, that is being split.</p>

<p>Avatars: When both users had avatars, both will be remain. When from_user had an avatar and destination_user did not have an avatar, the destination_user’s avatar will be deleted if it still matches what was there are the time of the merge. If the destination_user’s avatar was changed at anytime after the merge, it will remain on the destination user. If the from_user had an avatar it will be there after split.</p>

<p>Terms of Use: If from_user had not accepted terms of use, they will be prompted again to accept terms of use after the split. If the destination_user had not accepted terms of use, hey will be prompted again to accept terms of use after the split. If neither user had accepted the terms of use, but since the time of the merge had accepted, both will be prompted to accept terms of use. If both had accepted terms of use, this will remain.</p>

<p>Communication Channels: All communication channels are restored to what they were prior to the merge. If a communication channel was added after the merge, it will remain on the destination_user. Notification preferences remain with the communication channels.</p>

<p>Enrollments: All enrollments from the time of the merge will be moved back to where they were. Enrollments created since the time of the merge that were created by sis_import will go to the user that owns that sis_id used for the import. Other new enrollments will remain on the destination_user. Everything that is tied to the destination_user at the course level relating to an enrollment is moved to the from_user. When both users are in the same course prior to merge this can cause some unexpected items to move.</p>

<p>Submissions: Unlike other items tied to a course, submissions are explicitly recorded to avoid problems with grades. All submissions were moved are restored to the spot prior to merge. All submission that were created in a course that was moved in enrollments are moved over to the from_user.</p>

<p>Other notes: Access Tokens are moved back on split. Conversations are moved back on split. Favorites that existing at the time of merge are moved back on split. LTI ids are restored to how they were prior to merge.</p>


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl https://<canvas>/api/v1/users/<user_id>/split \
     -X POST \
     -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'
```
    


Returns a list of
 [User](users.md#user) objects.

  ## [Store custom data](#method.custom_data.set_data)<a name='method.custom_data.set_data'></a>


[CustomDataController#set_data](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/custom_data_controller.rb)







  
#### `PUT /api/v1/users/:user_id/custom_data(/*scope)`
**Scope:** `url:PUT|/api/v1/users/:user_id/custom_data(/*scope)`


<p>Store arbitrary user data as JSON.</p>

<p>Arbitrary JSON data can be stored for a User. A typical scenario would be an external site/service that registers users in Canvas and wants to capture additional info about them.  The part of the URL that follows <code>/custom_data/</code> defines the scope of the request, and it reflects the structure of the JSON data to be stored or retrieved.</p>

<p>The value <code>self</code> may be used for <code>user_id</code> to store data associated with the calling user. In order to access another user’s custom data, you must be an account administrator with permission to manage users.</p>

<p>A namespace parameter, <code>ns</code>, is used to prevent custom_data collisions between different apps.  This parameter is required for all custom_data requests.</p>

<p>A request with Content-Type multipart/form-data or Content-Type application/x-www-form-urlencoded can only be used to store strings.</p>

<p>Example PUT with multipart/form-data data:</p>

<pre class="code ruby"><code class="ruby">curl &#39;https://&lt;canvas&gt;/api/v1/users/&lt;user_id&gt;/custom_data/telephone&#39; \
  -X PUT \
  -F &#39;ns=com.my-organization.canvas-app&#39; \
  -F &#39;data=555-1234&#39; \
  -H &#39;Authorization: Bearer &lt;token&gt;&#39;
</code></pre>

<p>Response:</p>

<pre class="code javascript"><code class="javascript">{
  &quot;data&quot;: &quot;555-1234&quot;
}
</code></pre>

<p>Subscopes (or, generated scopes) can also be specified by passing values to <code>data</code>[<code>subscope</code>].</p>

<p>Example PUT specifying subscopes:</p>

<pre class="code ruby"><code class="ruby">curl &#39;https://&lt;canvas&gt;/api/v1/users/&lt;user_id&gt;/custom_data/body/measurements&#39; \
  -X PUT \
  -F &#39;ns=com.my-organization.canvas-app&#39; \
  -F &#39;data[waist]=32in&#39; \
  -F &#39;data[inseam]=34in&#39; \
  -F &#39;data[chest]=40in&#39; \
  -H &#39;Authorization: Bearer &lt;token&gt;&#39;
</code></pre>

<p>Response:</p>

<pre class="code javascript"><code class="javascript">{
  &quot;data&quot;: {
    &quot;chest&quot;: &quot;40in&quot;,
    &quot;waist&quot;: &quot;32in&quot;,
    &quot;inseam&quot;: &quot;34in&quot;
  }
}
</code></pre>

<p>Following such a request, subsets of the stored data to be retrieved directly from a subscope.</p>

<p>Example <a href="users.md#method.users.get_custom_data" title="GET">GET</a> from a generated scope</p>

<pre class="code ruby"><code class="ruby">curl &#39;https://&lt;canvas&gt;/api/v1/users/&lt;user_id&gt;/custom_data/body/measurements/chest&#39; \
  -X GET \
  -F &#39;ns=com.my-organization.canvas-app&#39; \
  -H &#39;Authorization: Bearer &lt;token&gt;&#39;
</code></pre>

<p>Response:</p>

<pre class="code javascript"><code class="javascript">{
  &quot;data&quot;: &quot;40in&quot;
}
</code></pre>

<p>If you want to store more than just strings (i.e. numbers, arrays, hashes, true, false, and/or null), you must make a request with Content-Type application/json as in the following example.</p>

<p>Example PUT with JSON data:</p>

<pre class="code ruby"><code class="ruby">curl &#39;https://&lt;canvas&gt;/api/v1/users/&lt;user_id&gt;/custom_data&#39; \
  -H &#39;Content-Type: application/json&#39; \
  -X PUT \
  -d &#39;{
        &quot;ns&quot;: &quot;com.my-organization.canvas-app&quot;,
        &quot;data&quot;: {
          &quot;a-number&quot;: 6.02e23,
          &quot;a-bool&quot;: true,
          &quot;a-string&quot;: &quot;true&quot;,
          &quot;a-hash&quot;: {&quot;a&quot;: {&quot;b&quot;: &quot;ohai&quot;}},
          &quot;an-array&quot;: [1, &quot;two&quot;, null, false]
        }
      }&#39; \
  -H &#39;Authorization: Bearer &lt;token&gt;&#39;
</code></pre>

<p>Response:</p>

<pre class="code javascript"><code class="javascript">{
  &quot;data&quot;: {
    &quot;a-number&quot;: 6.02e+23,
    &quot;a-bool&quot;: true,
    &quot;a-string&quot;: &quot;true&quot;,
    &quot;a-hash&quot;: {
      &quot;a&quot;: {
        &quot;b&quot;: &quot;ohai&quot;
      }
    },
    &quot;an-array&quot;: [1, &quot;two&quot;, null, false]
  }
}
</code></pre>

<p>If the data is an Object (as it is in the above example), then subsets of the data can be accessed by including the object’s (possibly nested) keys in the scope of a GET request.</p>

<p>Example <a href="users.md#method.users.get_custom_data" title="GET">GET</a> with a generated scope:</p>

<pre class="code ruby"><code class="ruby">curl &#39;https://&lt;canvas&gt;/api/v1/users/&lt;user_id&gt;/custom_data/a-hash/a/b&#39; \
  -X GET \
  -F &#39;ns=com.my-organization.canvas-app&#39; \
  -H &#39;Authorization: Bearer &lt;token&gt;&#39;
</code></pre>

<p>Response:</p>

<pre class="code javascript"><code class="javascript">{
  &quot;data&quot;: &quot;ohai&quot;
}
</code></pre>

<p>On success, this endpoint returns an object containing the data that was stored.</p>

<p>Responds with status code 200 if the scope already contained data, and it was overwritten by the data specified in the request.</p>

<p>Responds with status code 201 if the scope was previously empty, and the data specified in the request was successfully stored there.</p>

<p>Responds with status code 400 if the namespace parameter, <code>ns</code>, is missing or invalid, or if the <code>data</code> parameter is missing.</p>

<p>Responds with status code 409 if the requested scope caused a conflict and data was not stored. This happens when storing data at the requested scope would cause data at an outer scope to be lost.  e.g., if <code>/custom_data</code> was <tt>{“fashion_app”: {“hair”: “blonde”}}</tt>, but you tried to <tt>‘PUT /custom_data/fashion_app/hair/style -F data=buzz`</tt>, then for the request to succeed,the value of <code>/custom_data/fashion_app/hair</code> would have to become a hash, and its old string value would be lost.  In this situation, an error object is returned with the following format:</p>

<pre class="code javascript"><code class="javascript">{
  &quot;message&quot;: &quot;write conflict for custom_data hash&quot;,
  &quot;conflict_scope&quot;: &quot;fashion_app/hair&quot;,
  &quot;type_at_conflict&quot;: &quot;String&quot;,
  &quot;value_at_conflict&quot;: &quot;blonde&quot;
}
</code></pre>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```ns``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>The namespace under which to store the data.  This should be something other Canvas API apps aren’t likely to use, such as a reverse DNS for your organization.</p>  |
| ```data``` | Required ```JSON``` |  <p>The data you want to store for the user, at the specified scope.  If the data is composed of (possibly nested) JSON objects, scopes will be generated for the (nested) keys (see examples).</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/users/<user_id>/custom_data/food_app' \
  -X PUT \
  -F 'ns=com.my-organization.canvas-app' \
  -F 'data[weight]=81kg' \
  -F 'data[favorites][meat]=pork belly' \
  -F 'data[favorites][dessert]=pistachio ice cream' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'
```
    


#### Example Response:
    

```js
{
  "data": {
    "weight": "81kg",
    "favorites": {
      "meat": "pork belly",
      "dessert": "pistachio ice cream"
    }
  }
}
```
    



  ## [Load custom data](#method.custom_data.get_data)<a name='method.custom_data.get_data'></a>


[CustomDataController#get_data](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/custom_data_controller.rb)







  
#### `GET /api/v1/users/:user_id/custom_data(/*scope)`
**Scope:** `url:GET|/api/v1/users/:user_id/custom_data(/*scope)`


<p>Load custom user data.</p>

| ```ns``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>The namespace from which to retrieve the data.  This should be something other Canvas API apps aren’t likely to use, such as a reverse DNS for your organization.</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/users/<user_id>/custom_data/food_app/favorites/dessert' \
  -X GET \
  -F 'ns=com.my-organization.canvas-app' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'
```
    


#### Example Response:
    

```js
{
  "data": "pistachio ice cream"
}
```
    



  ## [Delete custom data](#method.custom_data.delete_data)<a name='method.custom_data.delete_data'></a>


[CustomDataController#delete_data](https://github.com/instructure/canvas-lms/blob/master/app/controllers/custom_data_controller.rb)







  
#### `DELETE /api/v1/users/:user_id/custom_data(/*scope)`
**Scope:** `url:DELETE|/api/v1/users/:user_id/custom_data(/*scope)`


<p>Delete custom user data.</p>

<p>Arbitrary JSON data can be stored for a User.  This API call deletes that data for a given scope.  Without a scope, all custom_data is deleted. See <a href="users.md#method.users.set_custom_data" title="Store Custom Data">Store Custom Data</a> for details and examples of storage and retrieval.</p>

<p>As an example, we’ll store some data, then delete a subset of it.</p>

<p>Example <a href="users.md#method.users.set_custom_data" title="PUT">PUT</a> with valid JSON data:</p>

<pre class="code ruby"><code class="ruby">curl &#39;https://&lt;canvas&gt;/api/v1/users/&lt;user_id&gt;/custom_data&#39; \
  -X PUT \
  -F &#39;ns=com.my-organization.canvas-app&#39; \
  -F &#39;data[fruit][apple]=so tasty&#39; \
  -F &#39;data[fruit][kiwi]=a bit sour&#39; \
  -F &#39;data[veggies][root][onion]=tear-jerking&#39; \
  -H &#39;Authorization: Bearer &lt;token&gt;&#39;
</code></pre>

<p>Response:</p>

<pre class="code javascript"><code class="javascript">{
  &quot;data&quot;: {
    &quot;fruit&quot;: {
      &quot;apple&quot;: &quot;so tasty&quot;,
      &quot;kiwi&quot;: &quot;a bit sour&quot;
    },
    &quot;veggies&quot;: {
      &quot;root&quot;: {
        &quot;onion&quot;: &quot;tear-jerking&quot;
      }
    }
  }
}
</code></pre>

<p>Example DELETE:</p>

<pre class="code ruby"><code class="ruby">curl &#39;https://&lt;canvas&gt;/api/v1/users/&lt;user_id&gt;/custom_data/fruit/kiwi&#39; \
  -X DELETE \
  -F &#39;ns=com.my-organization.canvas-app&#39; \
  -H &#39;Authorization: Bearer &lt;token&gt;&#39;
</code></pre>

<p>Response:</p>

<pre class="code javascript"><code class="javascript">{
  &quot;data&quot;: &quot;a bit sour&quot;
}
</code></pre>

<p>Example <a href="users.md#method.users.get_custom_data" title="GET">GET</a> following the above DELETE:</p>

<pre class="code ruby"><code class="ruby">curl &#39;https://&lt;canvas&gt;/api/v1/users/&lt;user_id&gt;/custom_data&#39; \
  -X GET \
  -F &#39;ns=com.my-organization.canvas-app&#39; \
  -H &#39;Authorization: Bearer &lt;token&gt;&#39;
</code></pre>

<p>Response:</p>

<pre class="code javascript"><code class="javascript">{
  &quot;data&quot;: {
    &quot;fruit&quot;: {
      &quot;apple&quot;: &quot;so tasty&quot;
    },
    &quot;veggies&quot;: {
      &quot;root&quot;: {
        &quot;onion&quot;: &quot;tear-jerking&quot;
      }
    }
  }
}
</code></pre>

<p>Note that hashes left empty after a DELETE will get removed from the custom_data store. For example, following the previous commands, if we delete /custom_data/veggies/root/onion, then the entire /custom_data/veggies scope will be removed.</p>

<p>Example DELETE that empties a parent scope:</p>

<pre class="code ruby"><code class="ruby">curl &#39;https://&lt;canvas&gt;/api/v1/users/&lt;user_id&gt;/custom_data/veggies/root/onion&#39; \
  -X DELETE \
  -F &#39;ns=com.my-organization.canvas-app&#39; \
  -H &#39;Authorization: Bearer &lt;token&gt;&#39;
</code></pre>

<p>Response:</p>

<pre class="code javascript"><code class="javascript">{
  &quot;data&quot;: &quot;tear-jerking&quot;
}
</code></pre>

<p>Example <a href="users.md#method.users.get_custom_data" title="GET">GET</a> following the above DELETE:</p>

<pre class="code ruby"><code class="ruby">curl &#39;https://&lt;canvas&gt;/api/v1/users/&lt;user_id&gt;/custom_data&#39; \
  -X GET \
  -F &#39;ns=com.my-organization.canvas-app&#39; \
  -H &#39;Authorization: Bearer &lt;token&gt;&#39;
</code></pre>

<p>Response:</p>

<pre class="code javascript"><code class="javascript">{
  &quot;data&quot;: {
    &quot;fruit&quot;: {
      &quot;apple&quot;: &quot;so tasty&quot;
    }
  }
}
</code></pre>

<p>On success, this endpoint returns an object containing the data that was deleted.</p>

<p>Responds with status code 400 if the namespace parameter, <code>ns</code>, is missing or invalid, or if the specified scope does not contain any data.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```ns``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>The namespace from which to delete the data.  This should be something other Canvas API apps aren’t likely to use, such as a reverse DNS for your organization.</p>  |


#### Example Request:
    

```bash
curl 'https://<canvas>/api/v1/users/<user_id>/custom_data/fruit/kiwi' \
  -X DELETE \
  -F 'ns=com.my-organization.canvas-app' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer <token>'
```
    


#### Example Response:
    

```js
!!!javascript
{
  "data": "a bit sour"
}
```

#### `POST /api/lti/subscriptions`
**Scope:** `url:POST|/api/lti/subscriptions`


<p>Creates a webook subscription for the specified event type and context.</p>

#### Request Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Description |
|-----------|------|-------------|
| ```subscription[ContextId]``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>The id of the context for the subscription.</p>  |
| ```subscription[ContextType]``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>The type of context for the subscription. Must be ‘assignment’, ‘account’, or ‘course’.</p>  |
| ```subscription[EventTypes]``` | Required ```Array``` |  <p>Array of strings representing the event types for the subscription.</p>  |
| ```subscription[Format]``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>Format to deliver the live events. Must be ‘live-event’ or ‘caliper’.</p>  |
| ```subscription[TransportMetadata]``` | Required ```Object``` |  <p>An object with a single key: ‘Url’. Example: { “Url”: “sqs.example” }</p>  |
| ```subscription[TransportType]``` | Required ```string``` |  <p>Must be either ‘sqs’ or ‘https’.</p>  |
